original: Orym: With those two pieces of evidence,[p/] we concluded that it could only be the necromancer kid that did it.
translation: Orym: 依据这两个证据，[p/]我们只能认为是那个死灵法师小子干的。

original: The Inquisition’s testimony is just as you expected.
translation: 裁判所的证言内容完全如你所料。

original: You’ve already found and identified the holes in Steelwind’s case.
translation: 但你已经发现并确定了斯蒂尔文德立证中的漏洞。

original: All you have to do is find that hole in the commander’s testimony.
translation: 你需要做的就是在指挥官的证言中找到那个漏洞。

original: JUDGE: Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] You may begin your cross-examination.
translation: JUDGE: 卡斯伯特先生，[p/]你可以开始交叉讯问了。

original: Orym: It started when the city watch got a call from the Imperial Academy.[p/] Someone was attacked,[p/] and the whole building was put in lockdown.
translation: Orym: 事情从城市安保收到帝国学院的电话开始说起。[p/]有人受到了攻击，[p/]然后所有的设施都被封锁了。

original: TYRION: What time did this call come in?
translation: TYRION: 报案具体是什么时间打来的？

original: Orym: A little after 3:00 PM.
translation: Orym: 下午3:00过一点点。

original: Orym: It was a few minutes after the murder was discovered.
translation: Orym: 那是谋杀事件被发现后几分钟。

original: Right…[p/] you remember that was around the time the lockdown occurred.
translation: 没错……[p/]你还记得那是封锁发生的时候。

original: Orym: We set up a perimeter around the area and waited for the lockdown system to deactivate.
translation: Orym: 我们在区域周围设立了警戒线，等待封锁系统解除。

original: Right.[p/] The lockdown can’t be ended manually.
translation: 没错.[p/]封锁不能手动解除。

original: So, they must have been forced to wait for the one-hour duration to elapse.
translation: 所以他们被迫等了一小时。

original: TYRION: How secure was this perimeter?
translation: TYRION: 当时警戒程度如何？

original: TYRION: Is it possible that someone slipped past you?
translation: TYRION: 会有人偷偷溜出去吗？

original: ARIA: The Inquisition was working in conjunction with the City Watch [i]and[/i] the Kingsguard.
translation: ARIA: 此案被高度重视，当时由裁判所、城市安保和国王卫队互相协作封锁相关地区。

original: ARIA: With that many people at the scene,[p/] it’s very unlikely that [i]anyone[/i] escaped unnoticed.
translation: ARIA: 规模十分巨大，[p/] 不太可能有人能溜出去。

original: True.[p/] For better or for worse,[p/] the kingdom will act quickly to protect a building filled with nobles.
translation: 确实，[p/] 不管怎样，[p/] 王国对于涉及到这么多贵族所在的场所当然十分重视。

original: Orym: When we finally got into the building,[p/] the prosecutor personally inspected the body and detected traces of [b]necromancy[/b] on it.
translation: Orym: 当我们终于能进入大楼时，[p/]检察官本人检查了尸体并探测到上面有[b]死灵术/b]的魔法痕迹。

original: TYRION: Why did the prosecutor inspect the body instead of the Inquisition?
translation: TYRION: 为什么是检察官检查尸体而不是裁判所？

original: ORYM: …Well-
translation: ORYM: 嗯....这个嘛...

original: ARIA: How I conducted the investigation is irrelevant to the proceedings.
translation: ARIA: 我本人如何进行调查取证与诉讼程序无关。

original: ARIA: …Or would you like to insinuate that [i]I’m[/i] not as competent as Commander White?
translation: ARIA: …还是说你的意思是我的能力不如指挥官奥蒙·怀特所以不配最先审查现场？

original: You don’t question her competency.
translation: 你并非怀疑她的能力。

original: But it’s still a bizarre decision on her part.
translation: 不过她这决定有些反常。

original: JUDGE: While the court admits that the prosecutor’s actions are unorthodox,[p/] we see no reason to question the prosecutor’s abilities.
translation: JUDGE: 尽管本庭承认检察官的行为不符程序，[p/]但我们相信检察官的个人能力。

original: ARIA: Thank you, Your Honor.
translation: ARIA: 感谢您的信任，法官阁下。

original: Orym: There were no cuts or bruises on the body either.[p/] The entire body was clean.
translation: Orym: 尸体上也没有创口或者瘀伤。[p/]尸体全身都是非常干净的，[p/] 连血渍都没有。

original: TYRION: How carefully was the body checked?
translation: TYRION: 尸体有没有经过彻底的检查？

original: TYRION: Perhaps the prosecution missed something.
translation: TYRION: 有可能检方遗漏了什么。

original: ARIA: The coroner couldn’t find even the smallest cut,[p/] bruise,[p/] or fracture on the body.
translation: ARIA: 验尸官没在尸体上找到任何伤口、[p/] 淤青和骨折。

original: ARIA: Furthermore,[p/] the alchemist’s report showed no signs of poison or disease.
translation: ARIA: 而且，[p/] 炼金术师的相关报告显示并非中毒或疾病所导致的死亡。

original: ARIA: The coroner was actually astounded at how unscathed the body was.
translation: ARIA: 验尸官本人也对尸体毫发无损的状态表示很震惊。

original: That makes sense.[p/] If someone had used [b]Mend Wounds[/b] on the body,[p/] it would have healed even the most minor of injuries.
translation: 嗯....[p/] 如果某人对尸体用过[b]疗愈术[/b]的话，[p/] 那么无论多么细小的割伤也会痊愈。

original: The question is…[p/] how do you prove that?
translation: 问题是.....[p/] 怎么证明死者死后受过法术治愈呢？

original: Orym: With those two pieces of evidence,[p/] we concluded that it could only be the necromancer kid that did it.
translation: Orym: 依据这两个证据，[p/]我们只能认为是那个死灵法师小子干的。

original: TYRION: And the prosecution believes that my client used [b]Necrotic Blight[/b]?
translation: TYRION: 检方认为被告使用了[b]索命咒[/b]？

original: ORYM: Yep.[p/] It’s the only way that the crime scene makes any sense.
translation: ORYM: 对，[p/]只有这样才说得通。

original: JUDGE: “[b]Necrotic Blight[/b]”?
translation: JUDGE: “[b]索命咒[/b]”？

original: JUDGE: I’m afraid I’ve never heard of this spell before.
translation: JUDGE: 本庭从未听说过这种法术。

original: ARIA: [b]Necrotic Blight[/b] is a spell that drains the life force from its target.
translation: ARIA: [b]索命咒[/b] 是种能够抽干目标生命力的法术。

original: ARIA: When used on a living human,[p/] it makes their bodily functions cease,[p/] instantly killing them.
translation: ARIA: 当对象是人类的时候，[p/]能造成目标身体机能停止，[p/]立即杀死目标。

original: JUDGE: I-[p/]I see…
translation: JUDGE: ...明白了

original: Gallery: What a horrible spell!
translation: Gallery: 这种法术真的令人毛骨悚然！

original: Gallery: That child should have never been allowed to learn something like that!
translation: Gallery: 是谁允许那小子学这种禁术的？！

original: Gallery: What were they [i]thinking[/i]!
translation: Gallery: 他们脑子里在想什么？！

original: Ugh…[p/] Having that spell is [i]not[/i] doing Wallace any favors.
translation: 呃...[p/] 那种法术确实会给华莱士造成负面影响。

original: CELESTE: We already investigated the crime scene.
translation: CELESTE: 我们已经调查了犯罪现场。

original: CELESTE: So, we know that the Inquisition’s theory contradicts one of the clues that we found.
translation: CELESTE: 裁判所的理论肯定与我们发现的线索相悖。

original: TYRION: Right.[p/] All I have to do is present that contradiction to the court.
translation: TYRION: 嗯，[p/] 我只需要向法庭出示证据就可以了。

original: Tyrion: Your Honor![p/][s/] It's clear that the witness's testimony is contradictory!
translation: Tyrion: 法官阁下！[p/][s/] 很明显证人的证言有矛盾！

original: Tyrion: And [i]this[/i] piece of evidence proves it!
translation: Tyrion: 这就是相关证据！

original: Judge: I fail to see how [i]that[/i] proves anything, Mr. Cuthbert...
translation: Judge: 卡斯伯特先生....我没看出来这两者有什么关系

original: Tyrion: O-[p/]Oh...[p/] I guess you're right.
translation: Tyrion: 啊-[p/]哦..[p/] 好像是这样的

original: TYRION: Commander White.[p/] It appears that you’ve neglected to mention one key detail of the crime scene.
translation: TYRION: 怀特指挥官，[p/] 貌似你忽略了现场的一个至关重要的细节。

original: ORYM: Yeah?[p/] And what’s that?
translation: ORYM: 哈？[p/] 是什么？

original: TYRION: During your testimony,[p/] you said that “the entire body was clean”.
translation: TYRION: 在你的证言中提到，[p/]尸体非常干净。

original: TYRION: I [i]will[/i] admit that there weren’t any wounds on the body…
translation: TYRION: 我承认尸体上没有任何伤口...

original: TYRION: However,[p/][s/] the body was certainly not clean!
translation: TYRION: 但尸体可一点都不干净！

original: ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: …

original: TYRION: At the scene of the crime,[p/] there was a large pool of blood located where the body was.
translation: TYRION: 尸体所在位置有一个坑洼，里面全是血。

original: TYRION: This blood came from the victim’s body.[p/][s/] And it was definitely not clean like the commander testified!
translation: TYRION: 这些都是死者的血，[p/][s/]与指挥官的证言明显不符！

original: JUDGE: I’m sorry, Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] But I fail to see the significance of this.
translation: Judge: 抱歉……[p/]恐怕本庭并未听明白，卡斯伯特先生。

original: TYRION: I’d like to remind the court of the prosecution’s case against my client.
translation: TYRION: 我向法庭重申检方起诉被告的关键理由。

original: TYRION: They are accusing him of murdering the victim using [b]Necrotic Blight[/b]:[p/] a spell which would [i]not[/i] have physically wounded the victim.
translation: TYRION: 由于[b]索命咒[/b]的特殊性，[p/] 在杀害目标时不会对其造成任何物理伤口。

original: TYRION: So why was there any blood at all?!
translation: TYRION: 那为什么会有死者的血迹？！

original: ARIA: Let’s not get ahead of ourselves.
translation: ARIA: 你的思维太跳跃了。

original: ARIA: The fact still stands.[p/] There were no wounds on the body,[p/] nor were there any reports of poison or disease on the autopsy.
translation: ARIA: 事实仍是如此，[p/]尸体上没有任何伤口，[p/]也没有中毒或疾病的迹象。

original: ARIA: There are clearly magical elements in this case.
translation: ARIA: 显然本案涉及魔法。

original: TYRION: But Catherine Bellwether [i]was[/i] bleeding profusely at some point!
translation: TYRION: 但凯瑟琳·贝尔维瑟在死前某段时间一定大量出血！

original: TYRION: How else would there be a bloodstain on the body?!
translation: TYRION: 不然尸体处怎么可能会留下血迹？！

original: TYRION: Do you have an explanation for that, Ms. Steelwind?!
translation: TYRION: 对此你怎么解释？斯蒂尔文德检察官！

original: ARIA: …No.[p/] I'll admit that the prosecution doesn't have an explanation for that.
translation: ARIA: …我无法解释这一点。[p/] 我承认检方无法证明这一点的合理性。

original: ARIA: And while I do find the circumstances questionable,[p/] all other evidence clearly points to the defendant.
translation: ARIA: 我也认为这点很可疑，[p/] 但其他的所有证据都指向被告。

original: ARIA: If the victim wasn’t killed with [b]necromancy[/b],[p/] why was there a trace of it on the body?
translation: ARIA: 如果死者不是死于[b]死灵术[/b]，[p/]那尸体上为何会有相关的魔法痕迹？

original: TYRION: I’m glad you asked.
translation: TYRION: 你主动帮我提出来真是太好了。

original: TYRION: I’d like to present a spell that could have left a trace of [b]necromancy[/b] on the body!
translation: TYRION: 我申请向法庭出示另一种能在身体上留下[b]死灵术[/b]的魔法痕迹的法术！

original: Tyrion: [b]Necrotic Blight[/b]!
translation: Tyrion: 是[b]索命咒[/b]！

original: Aria: ...
translation: Aria: ...

original: Judge: ...
translation: Judge: ...

original: Celeste: ...
translation: Celeste: ……

original: Celeste: Um...[p/] Tyrion?
translation: Celeste: 唔...[p/] 提利昂？

original: Celeste: We're supposed to prove that the trace [i]wasn't[/i] left by [b]Necrotic Blight[/b].
translation: Celeste: 我们不是要证明魔法痕迹不是由[b]索命咒[/b]留下的吗？

original: Aria: It's clear that the defense is admitting defeat.
translation: Aria: 显然辩方已经承认败局已定了。

original: Aria: [b]Necrotic Blight[/b] is the only spell that would have left that trace.
translation: Aria: [b]索命咒[/b]是唯一一种能留下那种痕迹的法术。

original: Tyrion: W-[p/]Wait...[p/][s/] That was a mistake!
translation: Tyrion: 等-[p/]等下...[p/][s/]我搞错了！

original: Tyrion: I meant to present a [i]different[/i] spell.
translation: Tyrion: 我本来想出示另一个法术的。

original: Judge: Um...[p/] What is this?
translation: Judge: 嗯……[p/]这是什么？

original: Tyrion: [i]This[/i] is what left the trace of [b]necromancy[/b] at the crime scene.
translation: Tyrion: 这就是能在身体上留下[b]死灵术[/b]的魔法痕迹的东西！

original: Aria: I fail to see how [i]that[/i] could leave a trace of [b]necromancy[/b].
translation: Aria: 我并不觉得那东西能留下[b]死灵术[/b]的魔法痕迹。

original: Tyrion: O-[p/]Oh,[p/] I suppose you're right.
translation: Tyrion: 啊-[p/]哦..[p/] 好像是这样的

original: Tyrion: [i]However[/i],[p/][s/] [i]that's[/i] not the spell I was speaking of!
translation: Tyrion: 那个是我搞错了！

original: JUDGE: [b]Mend Wounds[/b]?
translation: JUDGE: [b]疗愈术[/b]？

original: JUDGE: Correct me if I’m wrong,[p/] but isn’t that a healing spell?
translation: JUDGE: 那不是个治愈法术吗？

original: TYRION: That’s correct, Your Honor.
translation: TYRION: 没错，法官阁下。

original: TYRION: Spells from the school of [b]necromancy[/b] can control the forces of death [i]and[/i] life!
translation: TYRION: [b]死灵术[/b]类法术能够控制生死之力。

original: TYRION: [b]Mend Wounds[/b] is, in fact, a [b]necromancy[/b] spell!
translation: TYRION: 实际上，[b]疗愈术[/b]属于[b]死灵术[/b]类法术！

original: JUDGE: Really, now?[p/] I wasn't aware of this…
translation: JUDGE: 真的吗？[p/] 这本庭确实不清楚...

original: TYRION: [i]Now[/i] I’d like the court to consider the following…
translation: TYRION: 我现在向法庭提出以下可能性....

original: TYRION: What would happen if Bellwether was wounded,[p/] and someone attempted to heal her using [b]Mend Wounds[/b]?
translation: TYRION: 如果贝尔维瑟身受重伤，[p/]然后这时刚好有人试着用 [b]疗愈术[/b]治愈她的伤口。

original: TYRION: All of her wounds would disappear from her body!
translation: TYRION: 那么她身体上的所有外伤都会消失！

original: JUDGE: Hm…[p/] I see.
translation: JUDGE: 嗯...[p/] 本庭懂你的意思了。

original: ARIA: ...Do you honestly think I'm that incompetent, Mr. Cuthbert?
translation: ARIA: ...你真觉得我有那么无能吗....？卡斯伯特先生。

original: Aria: Frankly,[p/] I'm a little insulted.
translation: Aria: 说实话，[p/] 我有点不爽。

original: Tyrion: ...What?
translation: Tyrion: …哈？

original: Aria: The Inquisition is well aware of what happens when a mage attempts to save a victim using [b]Mend Wounds[/b].
translation: Aria: 裁判所深知这种可能性所造成的后果。

original: Aria: The healers that arrived at the scene already confirmed that the victim was long dead.
translation: Aria: 治愈师到现场的时候就宣布受害者已经死亡了。

original: Aria: None of them attempted to heal her.
translation: Aria: 他们一眼就知道任何急救措施已经没用了。

original: Tyrion: ...Well,[p/] what if someone tried to heal her and didn't report it?
translation: Tyrion: ...嘛，[p/]如果有人偷偷治疗过她还向裁判所隐瞒事实呢？

original: Aria: Please.[p/] None of the healers would have anything to gain by doing so.
translation: Aria: 得了吧，[p/] 那么做有什么好处？

original: ARIA: In fact,[p/] as a necromancer,[p/] the defendant could have easily carried out the described scenario.
translation: ARIA: 实际上，[p/]作为死灵法师，[p/]被告可以很轻松的实施以下计划。

original: ARIA: He could have cast [b]Mend Wounds[/b] on the victim after murdering her to confound the investigation!
translation: ARIA: 他可以先对目标释放[b]疗愈术[/b]之后再杀害目标来混淆调查。

original: At the end of the day,[p/] the burden of the proof is on you.
translation: 举证的重担与夜幕一同压在你身上。

original: But if you could just find out who healed the body,[p/] this case is yours.
translation: 要是你能找到那个实施治疗的人，[p/]就能稳操胜券了。

original: And whoever this healer is…[p/] Valentina definitely knows her.
translation: 无论那个人是谁....[p/]瓦伦蒂娜肯定有你想要的答案。

original: TYRION: …
translation: TYRION: …

original: TYRION: Your Honor.[p/] I will admit that I don’t have any evidence to support my theory.
translation: TYRION: 法官阁下。[p/]我承认目前没有足够的证据来支撑我的理论。

original: TYRION: However,[p/] I [i]do[/i] believe that we can bring it to light.
translation: TYRION: 但是，[p/] 我有自信我能证明我的猜想。

original: TYRION: There may have been [i]two[/i] people that witnessed someone cast magic on the body.
translation: TYRION: 有两位目击证人看到了当时对尸体施法的人。

original: TYRION: Valentina and Valerie Ianus:[p/][s/] the sisters who discovered the body.
translation: TYRION: 瓦伦蒂娜·伊努斯和瓦莱丽·伊努斯[p/][s/]——发现尸体的一对姐妹。

original: ARIA: …This is nonsense.[p/] We’ve already questioned those two witnesses extensively.
translation: ARIA: …这没道理，[p/]我们已经严格审讯过这两位目击证人了。

original: ARIA: If they [i]had[/i] witnessed something like that,[p/] it would have come up in their testimony.
translation: ARIA: 如果她们真看到了什么，[p/] 她们会在审讯时告诉我们的。

original: TYRION: If that’s true,[p/] then you have nothing to lose by hearing their testimonies.
translation: TYRION: 如果真如你所说，[p/] 那么现在再听一遍她们的证词也未尝不可。

original: ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: …

original: ARIA: Very well.[p/] If you’re so confident,[p/] let’s hear the witness’s testimony.
translation: ARIA: 好吧，[p/] 既然你如此胸有成竹，[p/] 那就让我们听听她们的证言。

original: JUDGE: It seems the prosecution has no objections.
translation: JUDGE: 看来检方没有异议。

original: JUDGE: However…[p/] If this line of questioning leads nowhere,[p/] I will see no reason to further prolong this trial.
translation: JUDGE: 不过...[p/] 如果此次传唤没能为案件调查提供有价值的线索，[p/] 本庭认为此案的审理可以在此结束了。

original: JUDGE: Do you understand, Mr. Cuthbert?
translation: JUDGE: 卡斯伯特先生，你可否明白？

original: TYRION: …Of course, Your Honor.
translation: TYRION: …当然，法官阁下。

original: VALENTINA: …! [mind="Oh, crap! It’s that guy from before!" /]
translation: VALENTINA: …! [mind="糟了！是之前那个难办的家伙！" /]

original: VALENTINA: ... [mind="Is… he the necromancer’s lawyer?!" /]
translation: VALENTINA: ... [mind="他...他原来就是那个死灵法师的律师？！" /]

original: She just got on the stand,[p/] and she’s already stressed out.
translation: 她光是站在证人席就已经压力山大了。

original: This could work in your favor.
translation: 你赌对了。

original: ARIA: Witness,[p/] please state your name and occupation for the court.
translation: ARIA: 证人，[p/] 请你向法庭陈述你的姓名与职业

original: VALENTINA: U-[p/]Um…[p/] My name?
translation: VALENTINA: 啊-[p/]唔…[p/] 我的名字？

original: ARIA: Witness,[p/] there’s no need to be so nervous.
translation: ARIA: 证人，[p/]没必要如此紧张。

original: ARIA: We merely want to hear about what you saw on the day of the murder.
translation: ARIA: 我们只是想听听案发当天你的所见所闻。

original: VALENTINA: R-[p/]Right.[p/] I-[p/]it’s just that guy over there.[p/] He…
translation: VALENTINA: 啊-[p/]啊哈哈...[p/] 我知道了，[p/] 就是那边那个家伙让我有点...

original: ARIA: You mean, Mr. Cuthbert?
translation: ARIA: 你是指卡斯伯特先生？

original: ARIA: …Did this man harass you, witness?
translation: ARIA: …这个人骚扰过你吗？证人。

original: TYRION: W-[p/]Wait a minute…
translation: TYRION: 等-[p/]等下....

original: VALENTINA: U-[p/][s/]Um…[p/][s/] Yeah!
translation: VALENTINA: 唔-[p/][s/]唔…[p/][s/] 对！

original: VALENTINA: He like…[p/] [i]super[/i] harassed me!
translation: VALENTINA: 他就是…[p/] [i]超级[/i] 骚扰过我！

original: JUDGE: How shameful.
translation: JUDGE: 真是可耻。

original: JUDGE: I would expect a member of our justice system to behave more professionally.
translation: JUDGE: 本庭本以为我们司法体系的成员都具有绅士风范。

original: CELESTE: *snicker*
translation: CELESTE: *窃笑* 嘻嘻嘻嘻

original: TYRION: Oh, shut up…
translation: TYRION: 呃啊...连你也...

original: TYRION: A-[p/]Anyways,[p/] please state your name and occupation for the court, Ms. Ianus.
translation: TYRION: 总-[p/]总之，[p/] 请向法庭陈述你的姓名和职业。

original: VALENTINA: … [mind="Just calm down. He can’t prove anything."/]
translation: VALENTINA: … [mind="冷静，冷静，他什么都证明不了的。"/]

original: VALENTINA: …My name is Valentina Ianus.
translation: VALENTINA: …我叫瓦伦蒂娜·伊努斯。

original: VALENTINA: I'm a member of the kitchen staff at the Wyverngarde Imperial Academy.
translation: VALENTINA: 我就职于维文加德帝国学院，是厨房的工作人员。

original: ARIA: As I recall,[p/] you were one of the witnesses who discovered the body.
translation: ARIA: 如果我记得没错，[p/]当时发现尸体有两个人，[p/]而你是其中之一。

original: ARIA: Apparently,[p/] the defense finds your involvement suspect.
translation: ARIA: 显然，[p/]辩方认为你当时的行迹可疑。

original: VALENTINA: …
translation: VALENTINA: …

original: ARIA: Rest assured, Ms. Ianus.
translation: ARIA: 我向你保证，伊努斯女士。

original: ARIA: In this courtroom,[p/] you will be protected from Mr. Cuthbert’s… “harassment”.
translation: ARIA: 在这里，[p/] 你无需担心卡斯伯特先生的.....“骚扰”。

original: TYRION: Ugh…
translation: TYRION: 真是的…

original: ARIA: Now please testify to the court on what happened that day.
translation: ARIA: 现在请你向法庭陈述当天发生的事。

original: VALENTINA: Y-[p/]Yeah…
translation: VALENTINA: 好-[p/] 好的.....

original: Valentina: I was walking with my sister in the west wing when we noticed something in a nearby classroom.
translation: Valentina: 我当时正和我妹妹在校园西侧散步，突然看到附近的教室里有什么东西。

original: Valentina: We looked over to see what it was.[p/][s/] That's when we saw Ms. Bellwether bleeding on the ground!
translation: Valentina: 好奇心作祟，我们靠近去看到底是什么，[p/][s/] 结果竟然是贝尔维瑟教授躺在血泊中！

original: Valentina: My sister tried her best to help her,[p/] but the professor had already lost a lot of blood…
translation: Valentina: 我妹妹尽全力救助她，[p/]但教授已经失血过多.....

original: Valentina: While my sister did that,[p/] I used an emergency communication device to call for help.
translation: Valentina: 与此同时，[p/] 我使用学院里的紧急通讯装置来求助。

original: Valentina: But it was too late.[p/] By the time her bleeding stopped,[p/] she’d already lost too much blood…
translation: Valentina: 但已经太迟了，[p/] 止住血的时候，[p/] 她已经失血太多了...

original: CELESTE: Hm…[p/] If your theory is true,[p/] that means she just lied in her testimony.
translation: CELESTE: 嗯...[p/] 假设你的推测正确的话，[p/] 也就是说她在证言中撒了谎。

original: CELESTE: She’s definitely holding something back.
translation: CELESTE: 她肯定在隐瞒着什么。

original: TYRION: She definitely saw more than she’s letting on.
translation: TYRION: 她肯定还有什么难言之隐。

original: You just need to prove that somehow…
translation: 需要找个方法撬开她的嘴...

original: JUDGE: Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] You may begin your cross-examination.
translation: JUDGE: 卡斯伯特先生，[p/]你可以开始交叉讯问了。

original: Valentina: I was walking with my sister in the west wing when we noticed something in a nearby classroom.
translation: Valentina: 我当时正和我妹妹在校园西侧散步，突然看到附近的教室里有什么东西。

original: TYRION: Where were you two coming from?
translation: TYRION: 当时你们是从哪里走到案发现场附近的？

original: VALENTINA: We came from the kitchen.
translation: VALENTINA: 我们是从厨房那边过来的。

original: VALENTINA: We were taking a break after the lunch rush.
translation: VALENTINA: 午餐的供餐高峰期过后，我们想着去休息一下。

original: The cafeteria [i]is[/i] on the west side of the academy.
translation: 学院的自助餐厅在西侧。

original: It’s believable that they’d be on that side of the building.
translation: 发现尸体的偶然站得住脚。

original: ARIA: What did you see in the classroom, Ms. Ianus?
translation: ARIA: 当时你在教室里看到了什么？

original: Valentina: We looked over to see what it was.[p/][s/] That's when we saw Ms. Bellwether bleeding on the ground!
translation: Valentina: 好奇心作祟，我们靠近去看到底是什么，[p/][s/] 结果竟然是贝尔维瑟教授躺在血泊中！

original: TYRION: Did you notice anything else strange in the lecture hall?
translation: TYRION: 讲堂里当时有什么异常吗？

original: VALENTINA: Well, there [i]was[/i] that terrible smell.
translation: VALENTINA: 嗯，说起来当时讲堂里有股恶臭。

original: VALENTINA: It was awful.[p/] I almost couldn’t see because of how much I was tearing up.
translation: VALENTINA: 真的很呛很难闻，[p/] 这股味道呛的我不停流眼泪，[p/] 我都看不清东西。

original: VALENTINA: But other than that,[p/] I was mostly focused on the professor.
translation: VALENTINA:除此之外，[p/]我多数注意力都在教授身上。

original: It makes sense…[p/] It would be hard to notice anything else.
translation: 没什么问题...[p/]确实很难注意到其他事。

original: Valentina: My sister tried her best to help her,[p/] but the professor had already lost a lot of blood…
translation: Valentina: 我妹妹尽全力救助她，[p/]但教授已经失血过多.....

original: She tried to…[p/] “help her”?
translation: 试图...[p/]“救助他”？

original: TYRION: Ms. Ianus.[p/] How exactly did your sister try to help Ms. Bellwether?
translation: TYRION: 伊努斯，[p/]请问你妹妹具体是怎么救助贝尔维瑟教授的？

original: VALENTINA: W-[p/][s/]What? [mind="Agh! I slipped up!"/]
translation: VALENTINA: 哇-[p/][s/]啥？ [mind="啊哇！ 我说漏嘴了！"/]

original: VALENTINA: O-[p/][s/]Oh,[p/] um…
translation: VALENTINA: 啊-[p/][s/]唔，[p/]这个...

original: VALENTINA: My sister used first aid to try to stop the bleeding.
translation: VALENTINA: 她用医疗包来试图止血。

original: TYRION: I…[p/] see.[p/] Could you please add that detail to your testimony?
translation: TYRION: 我...[p/]明白了，[p/]你能把刚刚的新细节加入到证言中吗？

original: VALENTINA: Y-[p/][s/]Yeah…[p/] Sure.
translation: VALENTINA: 嗯-[p/][s/]嗯....[p/]好的。

original: Valentina: She used first aid and applied pressure to her wound to stop the bleeding.
translation: Valentina: 她用医疗包来帮助教授止血。

original: TYRION: Your sister knows how to use a first aid kit?
translation: TYRION: 你妹妹学过急救知识？

original: VALENTINA: Y-[p/]Yeah,[p/] it was covered in our training when we first started working.
translation: VALENTINA: 嗯-[p/]嗯，[p/]在入职培训中有涵盖这部分。

original: VALENTINA: With all the nobles around,[p/] I guess the headmaster wanted to make sure we were prepared.
translation: VALENTINA: 毕竟周围这么多贵族，[p/]校长也想准备万全以备不时之需。

original: TYRION: Hm…
translation: TYRION: 哼嗯…

original: Valentina: While my sister did that,[p/] I used an emergency communication device to call for help.
translation: Valentina: 与此同时，[p/] 我使用学院里的紧急通讯装置来求助。

original: TYRION: A device?
translation: TYRION: 什么装置？

original: ARIA: It’s an artificery device that allows for long-range communication.
translation: ARIA: 是种可以进行远距离交流的奥术能源装置。

original: ARIA: Some of those devices are placed around the school for use during an emergency.
translation: ARIA: 这些设备设置在校内的各个地方以备不时之需。

original: TYRION: I see.[p/] So who [i]did[/i] you contact?
translation: TYRION: 明白了，[p/] 你当时联系了谁？

original: VALENTINA: I wasn’t sure, honestly.
translation: VALENTINA: 说实话我不太确定。

original: VALENTINA: I could hear a lot of people talking on the other end.
translation: VALENTINA: 当时能听到对面有很多人。

original: ARIA: That particular device broadcasts to the headmaster’s office and the City Watch Barracks.
translation: ARIA: 那个特殊装置同时向校长办公室和城市安保播送语音。

original: ARIA: I imagine that’s why the headmaster was able to activate the lockdown so quickly.
translation: ARIA: 我想这也是校长能如此快的实行封锁的原因。

original: TYRION: I see.
translation: TYRION: 我知道了。

original: Valentina: But it was too late.[p/] By the time her bleeding stopped,[p/] she’d already lost too much blood…
translation: Valentina: 但已经太迟了，[p/] 止住血的时候，[p/] 她已经失血太多了...

original: TYRION: I see.[p/] That must have been a difficult experience for both of you.
translation: TYRION: 好的。[p/]对你们两位来说这肯定是个艰难的经历。

original: VALENTINA: It was especially hard on my sister.
translation: VALENTINA: 对我妹妹来说那尤其艰难。

original: VALENTINA: I think she blames herself for not being able to save her.
translation: VALENTINA: 我认为她因没能救到教授感到自责。

original: VALENTINA: We didn’t [i]like[/i] Professor Bellwether...[p/] But we still didn’t want her to die.
translation: VALENTINA: 我们[i]并不喜欢[/i]贝尔维瑟教授……[p/]但也没想过要她去死。

original: She seems sincere when she says that.
translation: 她说这句话的时候看上去很真诚。

original: And you don’t see any dissonant thoughts through the Eye either.
translation: 而且你也没有通过荷鲁斯之眼发现不相符的想法。

original: CELESTE: Honestly,[p/] her testimony makes a lot of sense.
translation: CELESTE: 老实说，[p/]她的证言很说得通。

original: CELESTE: It’s hard to figure out which parts she might be lying about.
translation: CELESTE: 很难找出她在哪一部分可能有说谎。

original: TYRION: There has to be a contradiction here somewhere…
translation: TYRION: 一定在哪个地方藏着矛盾……

original: CELESTE: Your theory is that Valentina saw someone use [b]Mend Wounds[/b] on Bellwether.
translation: CELESTE: 你的理论是，瓦伦蒂娜看见有人对贝尔维瑟使用了[b]疗愈术[/b]。

original: CELESTE: You should focus on the statements that describe how they both interacted with her.
translation: CELESTE: 你应该聚焦在描述她们如何与她互动的证词上。

original: Tyrion: Your Honor![p/][s/] It's clear that the witness's testimony is contradictory!
translation: Tyrion: 法官阁下！[p/][s/]很明显证人的证言存在矛盾！

original: Tyrion: And [i]this[/i] piece of evidence proves it!
translation: Tyrion: [i]这个[/i]就是证据！

original: Judge: I fail to see how [i]that[/i] proves anything, Mr. Cuthbert...
translation: Judge: 卡斯伯特先生....我没看出来这两者有什么关系

original: Tyrion: O-[p/]Oh...[p/] I guess you're right.
translation: Tyrion: 啊-[p/]哦……[p/] 好像是这样的。

original: ARIA: …Witness.[p/] What is the meaning of this?
translation: ARIA:……证人。[p/]这是什么意思？

original: VALENTINA: W-[p/][s/]what?[p/][s/] Why are you looking at me like that?
translation: VALENTINA: 怎-[p/][s/]怎么啦？[p/][s/]你为什么要这样看着我？

original: TYRION: Maybe [i]I[/i] can elaborate, Ms. Ianus.
translation: TYRION: 或许[i]我[/i]能解释清楚，伊努斯女士。

original: TYRION: You weren’t present in the gallery earlier,[p/] were you?
translation: TYRION: 你之前并没有在旁听席，[p/]对吗？

original: VALENTINA: N-[p/][s/]No.[p/] I was waiting in the lobby.
translation: VALENTINA: 没-[p/][s/]没有。[p/]我在大厅等候。

original: VALENTINA: Lady Steelwind told me to wait there.
translation: VALENTINA: 斯蒂尔文德小姐让我在那里等着。

original: TYRION: Well,[p/] I suppose I should consider myself lucky.
translation: TYRION: 好吧，[p/]或许我该觉得自己运气不错。

original: TYRION: You see, Ms. Ianus…[p/] One key element of the case is that the body [i]didn’t[/i] have any wounds on it.
translation: TYRION: 你看，伊努斯女士……[p/]这个案件中一个很关键的要素就是尸体上[i]没有[/i]任何伤口。

original: VALENTINA: Y-[p/]Yeah?[p/] So?
translation: VALENTINA: 是[p/]是啊？[p/]所以呢？

original: TYRION: [i]So[/i], please explain to the court, Ms. Ianus…
translation: TYRION: [i]所以[/i]，伊努斯女士，请你向法庭解释……

original: TYRION: How did Valerie apply first aid when there shouldn’t have been [i]any[/i] wounds on the body?!
translation: TYRION: 瓦莱丽是怎么在尸体上没有[i]任何[/i]伤口的情况下使用医疗包的？

original: VALENTINA: What?! [mind="Ah! No… I screwed up…"/]
translation: VALENTINA: 啊？！ [mind="啊！不要……我搞砸了……"/]

original: VALENTINA: I-[p/][s/]I… [mind="But I saw that wound on her! What happened?!"/]
translation: VALENTINA: 我-[p/][s/]我……[mind="但我看到她身上的伤口了！到底是什么情况？！"/]

original: JUDGE: There’s clearly something amiss here.
translation: JUDGE: 这里显然有些不对劲。

original: JUDGE: But I’m afraid I don’t fully understand the implications of this.
translation: JUDGE: 但本庭恐怕还没有完全明白其中的含义。

original: JUDGE: Are you accusing the witness of committing perjury, Mr. Cuthbert?
translation: JUDGE: 你是在指控证人作了伪证吗，卡斯伯特先生？

original: When someone lies,[p/] they stay as close to the truth as possible while changing minute details.
translation: 当一个人说谎的时候，[p/]尽管细节发生了变化，但结果还是会尽量贴近真相。

original: In her thoughts,[p/] Valentina said that she was sure that she [i]saw[p/] a wound on Bellwether...
translation: 根据她的想法，[p/]瓦伦蒂娜说她很确信她[i]看见了[i/][p/]了贝尔维瑟身上有一处伤口。

original: And she also mentioned that [i]Valerie[/i] was the one that tried to save the professor.
translation: 她也提到了[i]瓦莱丽[/i]就是尝试救助教授的那个人。

original: If she didn't try to save Bellwether with first aid,[p/][s/] could she have used magic instead?
translation: 如果她没有尝试用医疗包救助贝尔维瑟，[p/][s/]反过来说，她会不会是使用了魔法呢？

original: Her sister could be the mage that you're looking for!
translation: 她妹妹可能就是那个你在找的法师！

original: TYRION: The witness [i]was[/i] lying, Your Honor…[p/] But not about everything.
translation: TYRION: 证人[i]确实[/i]说了谎，法官阁下……[p/]但不是所有的内容。

original: TYRION: Valerie Ianus [i]did[/i] try to save the victim's life by addressing her wounds.
translation: TYRION: 瓦莱丽·伊努斯[i]的确[/i]尝试通过处理伤口挽救受害人的性命。

original: TYRION: But she didn’t use first aid…[p/][s/] She used magic!
translation: TYRION: 但她不是用医疗包……[p/][s/]而是用魔法！

original: VALENTINA: …?! [mind="N-No! He found us out?!"/]
translation: VALENTINA: ……？！[mind="不-不要！他发现我们的问题了？"/]

original: ARIA: I'm sorry, Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] But your theory is completely flawed.
translation: ARIA: 很抱歉，卡斯伯特先生。[p/]但你的说法完全站不住脚。

original: TYRION: ...How so, Ms. Steelwind?
translation: TYRION: ……这又从何说起，斯蒂尔文德女士？

original: ARIA: Well,[p/] it’s quite simple.
translation: ARIA: 好吧，[p/]其实很简单。

original: ARIA: We’ve already verified that neither of the sisters are mages.
translation: ARIA: 我们已经确认了，两姐妹都不是法师。

original: TYRION: …What?!
translation: TYRION: ……什么？

original: TYRION: W-[p/]Wait…[p/] How can you be so sure?
translation: TYRION: 等-[p/]等一下……[p/]你怎么这么确定？

original: ARIA: During the investigation,[p/] we had both the Ianus sisters attune to a [b]Spell Compendium[/b].
translation: ARIA: 在调查中，[p/]我们已经让伊努斯两姐妹与[b]法术汇编[/b]进行了同步。

original: ARIA: It’s standard procedure for the Inquisition when interviewing witnesses.
translation: ARIA: 这是裁判所在询问证人时的标准程序。

original: Tyrion: T-[p/]Then that means...
translation: Tyrion: 也-[p/]也就是说……

original: Aria: That's correct.
translation: Aria: 没错。

original: ARIA: Neither of the Ianus sisters could attune to a [b]Compendium[/b]!
translation: ARIA: 伊努斯姐妹都无法与[b]法术汇编[/b]同步！

original: VALENTINA: H-[p/][s/]Ha![p/][s/] T-[p/][s/]That’s right![p/][s/] The Inquisition checked us both!
translation: VALENTINA: 呵-[p/][s/]哈！[p/][s/]没-[p/][s/]没错！[p/][s/]裁判所已经检查过我们两个了！

original: VALENTINA: [i]Neither[/i] of us are mages! [mind="Phew… that was close…"/]
translation: VALENTINA: 我们俩[i]都不是[/i]法师！ [mind="呼……好险啊……"/]

original: Damn it![p/] Were you wrong about Valerie being a mage, then…?
translation: 该死的！[p/]“瓦莱丽是法师”这个想法是错误的吗？那么……

original: No…[p/] That can’t be right.
translation: 不对……[p/]一定不是这样。

original: VALENTINA: …?! [mind="N-No! He found us out?!"/]
translation: VALENTINA: ……？！[mind="不-不要！他发现我们的问题了？"/]

original: Her thoughts said, “He found us out”.[p/] That means that you [i]were[/i] on the right track.
translation: 她的想法已经说出来了，“他发现了我们的问题”。[p/]也就是说你的想路[i]处于正轨[/i]。

original: Valerie [i]has[/i] to be the mage you’re looking for.
translation: 瓦莱丽[i]只能是[/i]你在找的那个法师。

original: TYRION: Celeste.[p/] Is it possible for a mage to hold a [b]Spell Compendium[/b] and avoid attuning to it?
translation: TYRION: 塞莱斯特。[p/]法师触碰[b]法术汇编[/b]却避免与它同步，这种事情做得到吗？

original: CELESTE: No…[p/] It just needs to be on their person.
translation: CELESTE: 不行吧……[p/]只要带在身上就生效了。

original: CELESTE: ...When I was arrested,[p/] the Inquisition also made me attune to one of their [b]Spell Compendiums[/b].
translation: CELESTE: ……我被逮捕的时候，[p/]裁判所也让我与他们提供的一个[b]法术汇编[/b]同步。

original: CELESTE: They were really careful to make sure that I did the attunement correctly.
translation: CELESTE: 他们很小心地确认了我准确地完成了同步。

original: CELESTE: There’s no way a mage could avoid attuning to a [b]Compendium[/b] with them watching you.
translation: CELESTE: 在他们的监视下一个法师没办法避免与[b]法术汇编[/b]同步的。

original: Right...[p/] Commander White may be negligent sometimes,[p/] but even [i]he[/i] isn’t that careless.
translation: 没错……[p/]怀特指挥官可能偶尔疏忽，[p/]但就算是[i]他[/i]也没那么大意。

original: ARIA: Now if you’re done,[p/] I do believe that you’ve exhausted all your options.
translation: ARIA: 如果你们讨论完了，[p/]我相信你们已经用完了所有可能的选项。

original: TYRION: W-[p/][s/]wait![p/][s/] I’m still not done cross-examining this witness!
translation: TYRION: 等-[p/][s/]等一下！[p/][s/]我还没对证人交叉讯问呢！

original: ARIA: ...What could you possibly hope to glean from her testimony?
translation: ARIA: ……你又希望从她的证词中得到什么呢？

original: TYRION: …
translation: TYRION: ……

original: Valentina should be stressed out enough to see more of her thoughts.
translation: 瓦伦蒂娜应当已经受到了足够的压力，可以看看她还有什么想法。

original: …But you can’t exactly say that you’re planning to read her mind.
translation: ……但你也不能举证说你是读了她的心所以知道这些。

original: TYRION: T-[p/][s/]There’s one key element of her testimony that the court is overlooking!
translation: TYRION: 她、p/][s/]她的证词里还有一个关键点是在之前的庭审里忽略了的！

original: TYRION: I have a right as an attorney to complete my cross-examination.
translation: TYRION: 我作为律师有权利完成这次交叉讯问。

original: ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: ……

original: ARIA: Your Honor.[p/] The defense is clearly trying to buy time.
translation: ARIA: 法官阁下。[p/]辩方明显只是在试着拖延时间。

original: JUDGE: Hm…[p/] I might be compelled to agree with you.
translation: JUDGE: 嗯……[p/]本庭可能不得不同意你的观点。

original: JUDGE: However,[p/] I'll also admit that [i]some[/i] elements of the witness’s testimony are quite peculiar.
translation: JUDGE: 然而，[p/]本庭也承认证人的证词中有[i]一些[/i]内容不太寻常。

original: JUDGE: I will allow the defense to perform one more cross-examination.
translation: JUDGE: 本庭决定允许辩方再进行一次交叉讯问。

original: That was close.
translation: 好险。

original: JUDGE: …But know that this is your last chance, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: JUDGE: ……但是请记住，这是你的最后一次机会，卡斯伯特先生。

original: JUDGE: If you produce nothing substantial,[p/] I [i]will[/i] pass my verdict.
translation: JUDGE: 如果你没有得出什么重要的内容，[p/]本庭[i]会[/i]直接宣布判决。

original: TYRION: O-[p/]Of course, Your Honor.
translation: TYRION: 没、[p/]没问题，法官阁下。

original: Alright…[p/] It’s all or nothing.
translation: 好吧……[p/]只能孤注一掷了。

original: If you can’t find anything by reading her mind…[p/] this whole case is finished.
translation: 如果你不能在她的想法里找到什么……[p/]案件就会这么结束。

original: ARIA: …Witness.[p/] Please give your testimony, once more.
translation: ARIA: ……证人。[p/]请重述你的证词。

original: VALENTINA: U-[p/]Um... [p/]Okay… [mind="Damn it! How long does he plan to keep me up here?!"/]
translation: VALENTINA: 啊-[p/]唔…[p/]好的……[mind="该死！他还想让我在这里呆多久？！"/]

original: Valentina: Like I said,[p/] my sister and I saw Ms. Bellwether bleeding on the ground.[p/] We rushed over to her. [mind="I was definitely surprised when I saw her like that."/]
translation: Valentina: 正如我说过的，[p/]我的妹妹和我看见贝尔维瑟女士倒在血泊之中。[p/]我们赶紧冲过去查看她。[mind="看到她那个样子我确实很惊讶。"/]

original: Valentina: N-[p/][s/]Now that you mention it…[p/] I don’t know if I saw any wounds on her.[p/] But I definitely saw blood! [mind="I can’t go back on that now… I just need to play dumb."/]
translation: Valentina: 既、[p/][s/]既然你提到了……[p/]我也不知道我有没有看清她身上有伤口。[p/]但我肯定看到血了！[mind="这一点上没法回头了……我只好装傻了。"/]

original: Valentina: My sister tried to save her![p/][s/] But she didn’t use any magic! [mind="Ugh, Valerie… You’re too kind-hearted for your own good…"/]
translation: Valentina: 我妹妹尝试救助她！[p/][s/]但她没使用什么魔法！[mind="啊, 瓦莱丽……你人太好了……"/]

original: Valentina: Neither of us is a mage![p/][s/] Both of us held that book the knights gave us! [mind="I was caught off guard when they asked us. They almost found us out."/]
translation: Valentina: 我们俩都不是法师！[p/][s/]我们都碰了骑士们给我们的那本书！[mind="他们讯问我的时候我有点措手不及。他们差点就发现了。"/]

original: Valentina: The commander was watching us the whole time![p/][s/] He can confirm it! [mind="It’s a good thing that we’re twins… Or else that trick wouldn’t have worked."/]
translation: Valentina: 指挥官全程都在监视我们！[p/][s/]他可以作证！mind="还好我们是双胞胎……不然这个把戏行不通的。"/]

original: CELESTE: What are we going to do…?
translation: CELESTE: 你要怎么做……？

original: CELESTE: They have pretty hard proof that Valerie isn’t a mage.
translation: CELESTE: 关于瓦莱丽不是法师这一点他们有相当确凿的证据。

original: TYRION: Valerie [i]is[/i] the mage we’re looking for.[p/] I’m sure of it.
translation: TYRION: 瓦莱丽[i]就是[/i]我们在找的那个法师。[p/]我很确定。

original: Tyrion: I'm just not sure why they felt the need to lie to the Inquisition.
translation: Tyrion: 我只是不确定为什么她们想要骗过裁判所。

original: And more importantly,[p/] [i]how[/i] did they trick the Inquisition?
translation: 并且更重要的是，[p/]她们[i]怎么[/i]骗过裁判所的？

original: Valentina: Like I said,[p/] my sister and I saw Ms. Bellwether bleeding on the ground.[p/] We rushed over to her. [mind="I was definitely surprised when I saw her like that."/]
translation: Valentina: 正如我说过的，[p/]我的妹妹和我看见贝尔维瑟女士倒在血泊之中。[p/]我们赶紧冲过去查看她。[mind="看到她那个样子我确实很惊讶。"/]

original: That matches the details of her previous testimony.
translation: 这与她先前的证言在细节上相符。

original: You have no reason to doubt this.
translation: 你没理由怀疑这一条。

original: Valentina: N-[p/]Now that you mention it…[p/] I don’t know if I saw any wounds on her.[p/] But I definitely saw blood! [mind="I can’t go back on that now… I just need to play dumb."/]
translation: Valentina: 既、[p/]既然你提到了……[p/]我也不知道我有没有看清她身上有伤口。[p/]但我肯定看到血了！[mind="这一点上没法回头了……我只好装傻了。"/]

original: Tyrion: ...It sounds like you're just backtracking on your previous testimony.
translation: Tyrion: 听起来你是在推翻之前的证词。

original: Valentina: I-[p/][s/]I'm not!
translation: Valentina:我、[p/][s/]我才没有啦！

original: Valentina: I just assumed she was wounded because of all the blood!
translation: Valentina: 我只是因为看到那么多的血假设她受了伤！

original: Valentina: How was [i]I[/i] supposed to know that someone closed her wounds?!
translation: Valentina: [i]我[/i]怎么可能知道有人愈合了她的伤口？！

original: Her thoughts imply that she's lying.[p/] But her logic is sound.
translation: 她的想法表明她在说谎。[p/]但她的发言逻辑上没有问题。

original: You'll need to look at her other statements and the thoughts that accompany them.
translation: 你需要仔细看看她的其他证词与伴随出现的想法。

original: Valentina: My sister tried to save her![p/][s/] But she didn’t use any magic! [mind="Ugh, Valerie… You’re too kind-hearted for your own good…"/]
translation: Valentina: 我妹妹尝试救助她！[p/][s/]但她没使用什么魔法！[mind="啊, 瓦莱丽……你人太好了……"/]

original: Tyrion: If Valerie wasn't the one who closed her wounds,[p/] how did she try to "help" her?
translation: Tyrion: 如果瓦莱丽不是愈合她伤口的那个人，[p/]她怎么去“救助”她的？

original: Valentina: I-[p/]I don't know...
translation: Valentina: 我、[p/]我才不知道……

original: Valentina: She might have been looking for an open wound to apply first aid to.
translation: Valentina: 她可能只是在寻找一个需要包扎的可见创口。

original: Tyrion: But if we assume that you're telling the truth,[p/] there wouldn't be any wounds to find.
translation: Tyrion: 但如果我们假设你说的是事实，[p/]可见的伤口是找不到的。

original: Tyrion: My client would have already closed them to "confound the investigation".
translation: Tyrion: 被告也可能已经为了“扰乱调查”治愈了伤口。

original: Valentina: I'm telling you![p/][s/] I don't know!
translation: Valentina: 我告诉你了！[p/][s/]我不知道！

original: It's hard to work with her pleading ignorance of what happened.
translation: 她说自己不知道发生了什么，这一点很难令人接受。

original: Maybe you should try looking at the thoughts of her other statements.
translation: 或许你应该尝试看看她其他证词对应的想法。

original: Valentina: Neither of us is a mage![p/][s/] Both of us held the book the knights gave us! [mind="I was caught off guard when they asked us. They almost found us out."/]
translation: Valentina: 我们俩都不是法师！[p/][s/]我们都碰了骑士们给我们的那本书！[mind="他们讯问我的时候我有点措手不及。他们差点就发现了。"/]

original: They "almost" found them out?
translation: 他们“差一点”就发现了？

original: Tyrion: Can I assume that this "book" was an unattuned [b]Spell Compendium[/b]?
translation: Tyrion: 我可以认为这本“书”就是指未绑定的[b]法术汇编[/b]吗？

original: Aria: Yes.[p/] The Inquisition has a myriad of them.
translation: Aria: 是的。[p/]裁判所有很多库存。

original: Aria: It's standard procedure to have witnesses attune to them.
translation: Aria: 让证人与之绑定是标准程序。

original: Tyrion: But doesn't the kingdom require that mages register?
translation: Tyrion: 但王国不是要求法师必须注册吗？

original: Tyrion: Why don't you just cross-reference those records with the witnesses’ names?
translation: Tyrion: 你们将证人姓名与注册记录进行比对不就行了吗？

original: Aria: For whatever reason,[p/] many mages among the commonfolk dislike the concept of registering.
translation: Aria: 不论有什么原因，[p/]平民中的许多法师并不喜欢注册这个概念。

original: Aria: As a result,[p/] many of them choose to hide their powers illegally.
translation: Aria: 结果就是，[p/]他们中的很多人选择违法隐藏自己的力量。

original: Valentina: ...
translation: Valentina: ……

original: Valentina: The commander was watching us the whole time![p/][s/] He can confirm it! [mind="It’s a good thing that we’re twins… Or else that trick wouldn’t have worked."/]
translation: Valentina: 指挥官全程都在监视我们！[p/][s/]他可以作证！mind="还好我们是双胞胎……不然这个把戏行不通的。"/]

original: It's a "good thing that they're twins"?
translation: 她刚刚是在想“还好她们是双胞胎”？

original: Tyrion: ...Did you pull some kind of trick to [i]deceive[/i] the Inquisition while attuning, Ms. Ianus?
translation: Tyrion: ……你们绑定汇编的时候，你是不是耍了什么花招来[i]欺瞒[/i]裁判所，伊努斯女士？

original: Valentina: O-[p/]Of course not!
translation: Valentina: 当、[p/]当然没有！

original: Valentina: W-[p/][s/]We know that lying to Inquisition would get us in trouble!
translation: Valentina: 我、[p/][s/]我们知道向裁判所撒谎只会给我们自己惹麻烦的！

original: Valentina: Why would [i]either[/i] of us take a risk like that?!
translation: Valentina: 为什么我们中的[i]哪个人[/i]要冒这么大的风险啊？！

original: Tyrion: Living as an unregistered mage is a serious crime.
translation: Tyrion: 作为未注册的法师活动是一项严重的犯罪。

original: Tyrion: If Valerie [i]was[/i] a mage,[p/] then you would have been charged with fraud right then and there.
translation: Tyrion: 如果瓦莱丽[i]真的是[/i]一位法师，[p/]那个时候你们当场就会被指控犯了欺诈罪。

original: Valentina: Y-[p/]Yeah![p/][s/] But we already proved that neither of us are mages!
translation: Valentina: 没、[p/]没错啊！[p/][s/]但我们已经证明了我们姐妹俩都不是法师！

original: The Eye seems to differ.
translation: 你的荷鲁斯之眼看到并非如此。

original: Think through this.[p/] This isn’t like a normal cross-examination.
translation: 仔细想想。[p/]这不像一般的交叉讯问。

original: Nearly all of her thoughts will be suspicious and contrary to her testimony.
translation: 她几乎所有的想法都是可疑的，也与证言矛盾。

original: What you need to do is find the thought that gives you a thread to pull on.
translation: 你要做的就是找到给你一个切入点的那个想法。

original: In this case,[p/] you need to find the thought that implies how the twins tricked the commander.
translation: 在这个案件里，[p/]你需要找到暗示了这对双胞胎怎么愚弄了指挥官的那个想法。

original: Find the thought that holds that clue and INTERPRET it to proceed.
translation: 找到持有线索的那个想法，然后“解读”它来推进询问。

original: Tyrion: Your Honor![p/][s/] The witness's testimony contradicts what she truly thinks!
translation: Tyrion: 法官阁下！[p/][s/]证人的证词与她的真实想法矛盾了！

original: Judge: …I’m sorry.[p/] I fail to see how the witness’s statement contradicts anything.
translation: Judge: ……不好意思。[p/]本庭看不出来证人的发言与什么东西有矛盾。

original: Tyrion: You’ll have to trust me, Your Honor.
translation: Tyrion: 拜托您一定要相信我，法官阁下。

original: Tyrion: I have an instinct for this sort of thing.
translation: Tyrion: 我对这类东西有直觉的。

original: Aria: Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] Your “instincts” do not make for concrete evidence.
translation: Aria: 卡斯伯特先生。[p/]你所谓的“直觉”并不能成为确凿的证据。

original: Aria: I can't believe I have to explain this to you...
translation: Aria: 真不敢相信我还得跟你解释这个……

original: Tyrion: R-[p/]Right…
translation: Tyrion: 是、[p/]是哦……

original: Well,[p/] you can’t exactly say that you can see her thoughts…
translation: 好吧，[p/]你不能直接说你看得到她的想法……

original: TYRION: Ms. Ianus.[p/] Your thoughts betray you.
translation: TYRION: 伊努斯女士。[p/]你的想法背叛了你。

original: VALENTINA: W-[p/][s/]What…?
translation: VALENTINA: 什、[p/][s/]什么意思……？

original: You found the thought.
translation: 你找到那一条想法了。

original: They must have done something…[p/] But, what…?
translation: 她们肯定做了什么……[p/] 但到底是什么呢……？

original: It must have happened when Commander White was interrogating them.
translation: 那一定发生在怀特指挥官审问她们的时候。

original: ARIA: Orym was the one who collected their statements.
translation: ARIA: 奥蒙负责记录了她们的证词。

original: TYRION: Did he notice anything off about their behavior?
translation: TYRION: 他有提到这两姐妹有什么行为吗？

original: ARIA: From what he said,[p/] they had a few quirks...[p/] But nothing too suspicious.
translation: ARIA: 按他的说法，[p/]她们是有点奇怪的举动……[p/]但并没有多可疑。

original: Tyrion: "Quirks"...?
translation: Tyrion: “奇怪的举动”……？

original: ARIA: He told me that they were “running and spinning” around him during questioning.
translation: ARIA: 他告诉我她们两个一直在询问时围着他“快速转圈圈”。

original: TYRION: What does [i]that[/i] mean?
translation: TYRION: [i]这[/i]又是什么意思？

original: ARIA: I have no idea.[p/] Perhaps they were still on edge after finding their coworker murdered.
translation: ARIA: 我也不清楚。[p/]可能在发现同事被谋杀后，她们紧张到了极限。

original: “Running and spinning"…
translation: “快速地转圈圈”

original: Her thoughts also said, “It’s a good thing that we’re twins”…
translation: 她的想法是这么说的，“还好我们是双胞胎”……

original: This means that their so-called “trick” wouldn’t have worked if they [i]weren't[/i] twins…
translation: 也就是说她们这个“花招”如果[i]不是[/i]双胞胎就行不通……

original: No...[p/] There has to be a way that the twins tricked Commander White.
translation: 不对……[p/]这对双胞胎肯定用了什么办法与弄了怀特指挥官。

original: Steelwind said that the two of them were “running and spinning around him”.
translation: 斯蒂尔文德硕果她们两个当时在“围着他快速转圈圈”。

original: Why would they do something like that?
translation: 她们干嘛要那样做？

original: Of course![p/][s/] They switched places!
translation: 当然了！[p/][s/]她们调换了位置！

original: Valentina attuned to the first [b]Spell Compendium[/b]!
translation: 瓦伦蒂娜先去与第一个[b]法术汇编[/b]绑定！

original: Then she pretended to be Valerie to attune to the second one!
translation: 然后她假装成瓦莱丽去绑定第二个！

original: Commander White couldn’t tell the difference between them!
translation: 怀特指挥官分不清她们两个人！

original: TYRION: Ms. Ianus.[p/] There’s something I want to confirm.
translation: TYRION: 伊努斯小姐。[p/]有一件事我要确认一下。

original: TYRION: During the investigation,[p/] both you and Valerie attuned to a [b]Spell Compendium[/b].
translation: TYRION: 调查过程中，[p/]你和瓦莱丽两个人确实都绑定了各自的[b]法术汇编[/b]。

original: Tyrion: Am I correct?
translation: Tyrion: 我说得对吗？

original: VALENTINA: Y-[p/][s/]Yeah.[p/][s/] That knight [i]watched[/i] us do it!
translation: VALENTINA: 对、[p/][s/]对的。[p/][s/]那个骑士全程[i]监督[/i]了的！

original: TYRION: And how did he have you do this?
translation: TYRION: 他具体是怎么让你们实施的？

original: TYRION: Did you both attune to those [b]Compendiums[/b] at the same time?
translation: TYRION: 你们是同时与各自的[b]法术汇编[/b]绑定的吗？

original: TYRION: ...Or did you attune one after another?
translation: TYRION: 或者说，你们在绑定一个后又绑定了另一个？

original: VALENTINA: W-[p/][s/]What?! [mind="No way! Does he know what we did?!" /]
translation: VALENTINA: 啊、[p/][s/]啊？！[mind="不会吧！他怎么知道我们怎么做的？！" /]

original: ARIA: I fail to see how that makes any difference, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: ARIA: 我看不出来这两者有什么区别，卡斯伯特先生。

original: JUDGE: Yes.[p/] I agree.
translation: JUDGE: 是的，[p/]本庭也看不出来。

original: JUDGE: The [b]Spell Compendiums[/b] would work regardless of what order they went in.
translation: JUDGE: 不论她们按什么顺序操作，[b]法术汇编[/b]的结果是一样的。

original: TYRION: You may not be aware of this, Your Honor.
translation: TYRION: 法官阁下，可能您还没有注意到。

original: TYRION: But Valentina and Valerie Ianus are identical twins.
translation: TYRION: 瓦伦蒂娜·伊努斯和瓦莱丽·伊努斯是一对双胞胎。

original: Tyrion: Which [i]means[/i] that their physical appearances are nearly identical to each other.
translation: Tyrion: [i]也就是说[/i]她们的外表几乎完全一致。

original: TYRION: If Commander White didn’t have them attune at the same time,[p/][s/] what would stop the twins from switching places with each other?!
translation: TYRION: 如果怀特指挥官没有命令她们同时尝试绑定，[p/][s/]他有什么办法阻止这对双胞胎伪装成彼此呢？

original: VALENTINA: …!
translation: VALENTINA: ……！

original: ARIA: This is clearly nothing but baseless conjecture.
translation: ARIA: 这只不过是无根据的猜想罢了。

original: ARIA: Orym wouldn’t fail at such a basic task.
translation: ARIA: 奥蒙可不会这么简单的工作都做不好。

original: TYRION: Really, Prosecutor Steelwind?
translation: TYRION: 真的吗，斯蒂尔文德检察官？

original: TYRION: Do you find it hard to believe that [i]Commander White[/i] would fail at a task like this?
translation: TYRION:你很难相信[i]怀特检察官[/i]会在这么简单的任务中失败吗？

original: ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: ……

original: VALENTINA: W-[p/][s/]Wait a minute![p/][s/] This is crazy!
translation: VALENTINA: 等、[p/][s/]等一下呀！[p/][s/]这也太扯了！

original: VALENTINA: We [i]didn’t[/i] trick the Inquisition!
translation: VALENTINA: 我们[i才没有[/i]欺骗裁判所！

original: VALENTINA: My sister and I are not mages!
translation: VALENTINA: 我们两姐妹都不是法师！

original: TYRION: Then prove it, Ms. Ianus!
translation: TYRION: 那就证明这一点啊，伊努斯小姐！

original: TYRION: Bring in your sister and we’ll have you attune to [i]two[/i] [b]Spell Compendiums[/b] at the same time!
translation: TYRION: 把你妹妹带过来，然后我们会让你们[i]两个[/i]同时绑定[b]法术汇编[/b]！

original: VALENTINA: N-[p/][s/]No…[p/][s/] wait!
translation: VALENTINA: 不、[p/][s/]不行……[p/][s/]等一下！

original: JUDGE: Order in the court!
translation: JUDGE: 注意法庭秩序！

original: JUDGE: It’s clear that we won’t get anywhere unless we test the defense’s theory.
translation: JUDGE: 很显然，除非验证辩方的主张，否则庭审无法继续。

original: JUDGE: Bailiff![p/][s/] Escort Valerie Ianus to the stand,[p/] and bring two unattuned [b]Spell Compendiums[/b]!
translation: JUDGE: 法警！[p/][s/]把瓦莱丽·伊努斯护送到证人席，[p/]再送来两个未绑定的[b]法术汇编[/b]！

original: VALERIE: …
translation: VALERIE: ……

original: CELESTE: They’ve both had their hands on those Compendiums for the last ten minutes.
translation: CELESTE: 她们都已经把自己的手放在法术汇编上十分钟了。

original: CELESTE: There’s no way they can fake it in front of this many people.
translation: CELESTE: 在众目睽睽之下她们也没办法造假。

original: Alright…[p/] It's the moment of truth.
translation: 好吧……[p/]这就是揭露真相的时刻。

original: You can only hope that your theory is correct.
translation: 你只能希望你的主张正确无误。

original: ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: ……

original: ARIA: No…![p/][s/] Did he seriously-?!
translation: ARIA: 不是吧……！[p/][s/]他真的——？！

original: JUDGE: W-[p/][s/] What is it, Prosecutor Steelwind?
translation: JUDGE: 怎、[p/][s/]怎么了，斯蒂尔文德检察官？

original: JUDGE: What do you see?
translation: JUDGE: 你发现什么了？

original: ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: ……

original: ARIA: What I [i]see[/i] is Commander White seeking new employment in the near future...
translation: ARIA: 我[i]发现[/i]怀特指挥官最近要找一个新工作……

original: ARIA: *sigh*[p/] It appears that the defense was correct.
translation: ARIA: *叹气*[p/]看起来辩方是正确的。

original: ARIA: Valentina Ianus isn’t a mage…[p/] but Valerie Ianus is.
translation: ARIA: 瓦伦蒂娜·伊努斯确实不是法师……[p/]但是瓦莱丽·伊努斯是。

original: ARIA: What’s more,[p/] Valerie Ianus’s [b]Compendium[/b] contains the [b]Mend Wounds[/b] spell.
translation: ARIA: 还有，[p/]瓦莱丽·伊努斯的[b]法术汇编[/b]包括了[b]疗愈术[/b]这个魔法。

original: ARIA: Which…[p/] makes the defense’s theory entirely plausible.
translation: ARIA: 这……[p/]使得辩方的主张完全合理。

original: VALERIE: P-[p/][s/]Please...[p/][s/] Just allow me to explain...
translation: VALERIE: 拜、[p/][s/]拜托……[p/][s/]让我解释一下……

original: ARIA: We should allow you to explain [i]what[/i] exactly?
translation: ARIA: 我们应该让你解释一下[i]发生了什么[/i]吗？

original: ARIA: You're an unregistered mage.
translation: ARIA: 你是个没有注册的法师。

original: ARIA: And you and your sister have made fools out of all of us with your perjury.
translation: ARIA: 而且你和你的姐姐用伪证让我们出丑。

original: VALERIE: …
translation: VALERIE: ……

original: VALERIE: How would you know what it’s like, [i]Lady[/i] Steelwind?
translation: VALERIE: 您怎么会明白这是什么样的感受，斯蒂尔文德[i]小姐[/i]？

original: ARIA: …What?
translation: ARIA: ……什么意思？

original: VALERIE: Did you think we didn’t notice your name?
translation: VALERIE: 您觉得我们没有注意到你的姓氏吗？

original: VALERIE: You’re not like us.[p/] You don’t [i]have[/i] to hide.
translation: VALERIE: 您和我们并不一样。[p/]您[i]不必[/i]隐藏什么。

original: ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: ……

original: VALERIE: Whatever...[p/] This whole situation has gotten out of hand.
translation: VALERIE: 无论如何……[p/]现在整个庭审已经有些失控了。

original: VALERIE: I didn’t think hiding it would cause so much trouble.
translation: VALERIE: 我之前没想到隐藏这一点会造成这么多问题。

original: VALERIE: And I won’t let someone go to prison because of me,[p/] even if he [i]is[/i] a necromancer.
translation: VALERIE: 而我也不会让其他人因为我被误判投狱，[p/]就算他[i]是[/i]一个死灵法师。

original: VALERIE: …Please let me testify about what I saw.
translation: VALERIE: ……请让我就我所见进行作证。

original: VALERIE: I’ll tell you what really happened that day.
translation: VALERIE: 我将告诉你那天实际上发生了什么。

original: JUDGE: …Very well.
translation: JUDGE: ……很好。

original: JUDGE: But understand that there will be repercussions for your actions, witness.
translation: JUDGE: 但你要明白你的行为会招致对应的处理结果，证人。

original: VALERIE: Yes…[p/] I know...
translation: VALERIE: 是的……[p/]我明白……

original: Valerie: My sister and I were walking in the hallway from the kitchen to the foyer.
translation: Valerie: 我姐姐和我当时走在从厨房到前厅的走廊上。

original: Valerie: Then I suddenly spotted the professor lying in a pool of blood in a nearby classroom.
translation: Valerie: 然后我突然发现附近的教室里，教授倒在一片血泊之中。

original: Valerie: Valentina used a communication device to call for help while I tried to save her.
translation: Valerie: 瓦伦蒂娜用通讯设备呼叫求助，我同时试着挽救教授。

original: Valerie: I saw that she was bleeding,[p/] so I cast [b]Mend Wounds[/b] on her to close her wounds.
translation: Valerie: 我看到她正在流血，[p/]所以我对她施放了[b]疗愈术[/b]来愈合伤口。

original: Valerie: But it was too late.[p/] I closed the hole in her stomach,[p/] but she was already dead.
translation: Valerie: 但已经来不及了。[p/]我把她腹部的那个洞合上了，[p/]但她已经死亡。

original: JUDGE: …There was a hole in her stomach?
translation: JUDGE: 她肚子上有一个洞？

original: TYRION: Your Honor.[p/] As you can clearly see from the witness’ testimony,[p/] the trace of [b]necromancy[/b] was left by the witness,[p/] not my client.
translation: TYRION: 法官各写。[p/]您能通过证词清楚地知道，[p/][b]死灵术[/b]的魔法痕迹是证人留下的，[p/]不是我的委托人。

original: TYRION: What’s more,[p/] it’s clear that there was a [i]physical[/i] wound on the body.
translation: TYRION: 还有，[p/]很明显尸体上曾经有一处[i]明显l[/i]的伤口。

original: JUDGE: I-[p/][s/]I see…[p/] Well…
translation: JUDGE: 本、[p/][s/]本庭明白了……那么……

original: His words trail off.
translation: 他马上就会说出来。

original: He clearly doesn’t want to pass a verdict when there’s no clear culprit.
translation: 法官在没有找到明确凶手的情况下并不想下达判决。

original: But he has no choice.[p/] The case against Wallace is predicated on Bellwether being killed by [b]necromancy[/b].
translation: 但他也没有选择，[p/]对华莱士的指控内容是他用[b]死灵术[/b]杀死了贝尔维瑟。

original: With Valerie’s testimony,[p/] the prosecution doesn’t have a shred of evidence implicating him.
translation: 按照瓦莱丽的证词，[p/]控方没有任何证据表明他有罪。

original: JUDGE: …
translation: JUDGE: ……

original: JUDGE: *sigh*[p/] Very well.[p/] The court sees no reason to prolong this trial.
translation: JUDGE: *叹气*[p/]好吧。[p/]看起来本庭也没有理由继续本次审理。

original: JUDGE: With these new developments,[p/] the court has no choice but to find Wallace Nightgrave not-
translation: JUDGE: 依据新发现的事实，[p/]本法庭已经没有其他选择，我们只能发现华莱士·奈特格雷夫没有——

original: ARIA: I believe the court is ignoring one key detail of the witness’s testimony.
translation: ARIA: 我相信本次庭审忽略了刚才证词中的一个关键细节。

original: TYRION: ...And what would that be, Ms. Steelwind?
translation: TYRION: ……你指的是什么，斯蒂尔文德女士？

original: ARIA: Let’s re-examine the witness’s testimony.
translation: ARIA: 我们重新检查一下证人的证词。

original: Valerie: Valentina used a communication device to call for help while I tried to save her.
translation: Valerie: 瓦伦蒂娜用通讯设备呼叫求助，我同时试着挽救教授。

original: Valerie: I saw that she was bleeding,[p/] so I cast [b]Mend Wounds[/b] on her to close her wounds.
translation: Valerie: 我看到她正在流血，[p/]所以我对她施放了[b]疗愈术[/b]来愈合伤口。

original: Valerie: But it was too late.[p/] I closed the hole in her stomach,[p/] but she was already dead.
translation: Valerie: 但已经来不及了。[p/]我把她腹部的那个洞合上了，[p/]但她已经死亡。

original: ARIA: The communication device that Valentina Ianus used logs the time of day during each use.
translation: ARIA: 瓦伦蒂娜·伊努斯使用的那个通讯设备会保存每次使用的时间日志。

original: Aria: From this log,[p/] we know that Valentina used this device at 3:04 PM.
translation: Aria: 从日志中，[p/]我们可以知道瓦伦蒂娜在下午3:04使用了这个设备。

original: ARIA: This was an hour after the time of death.
translation: ARIA: 这已经是死亡时间后的一个小时了。

original: TYRION: Where are you going with this?
translation: TYRION: 你想用这条信息做什么？

original: ARIA: Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] There was a witness who saw the victim before the body was found:[p/] Jan Hughes.
translation: ARIA: 卡斯伯特先生。[p/]其实有一位在被害人尸体被发现前见到过她本人的目击者：简·休斯。

original: ARIA: He,[p/] along with another witness,[p/] spotted Bellwether walking in the hallways before the body was found.
translation: ARIA: 他，[p/]与另一位证人一起，[p/]在贝尔维瑟的尸体被发现看到过她在走廊路过。

original: JAN: I was cleaning the halls.
translation: JAN: 我当时正在打扫大厅。

original: JAN: Bellwether knocked over a vase…[p/] There were shards and dirt everywhere.
translation: JAN: 贝尔维瑟撞到了一个花瓶……[p/]搞得满地都是碎片和泥土。

original: JAN: It was probably 20-30 minutes before the twins found the body.
translation: JAN: 那大概是那对双胞胎发现尸体前20到30分钟时发生的。

original: ARIA: “20-30 minutes” before the body was found.
translation: ARIA: 尸体被发现前的“20到30分钟”。

original: ARIA: Do you see the discrepancy, Mr. Cuthbert?
translation: ARIA: 你有发现不一致的地方吗，卡斯伯特先生？

original: TYRION: …!
translation: TYRION: ……！

original: Wait...[p/][s/] That can't be right!
translation: 等等……[p/][s/]不该是这样的！

original: Bellwether died more than an [i]hour[/i] before the body was found…
translation: 贝尔维瑟在尸体被发现时已经死了不止[i]一小时[/i]了……

original: So how did Jan see her half an hour [i]after[/i] her death?!
translation: 简怎么能在她[i]死后[/i]半小时看到她？！

original: ARIA: I wonder, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: ARIA: 我很好奇啊，卡斯伯特先生。

original: ARIA: How could one make a dead body move and walk around?
translation: ARIA: 怎样能使一具死尸到处行走呢?

original: TYRION: No…[p/] You can’t mean-!
translation: TYRION: 不……[p/]你不会是要说——！

original: ARIA: There was more than one piece of evidence that pointed to a necromancer committing the crime.
translation: ARIA: 现在有不止一个证据指向一个死灵法师实施了这次犯罪。

original: ARIA: The defendant murdered the victim and used [b]necromancy[/b] to animate her corpse!
translation: ARIA: 被告谋杀了被害人后还使用了[b]死灵术[/b]让她的尸体活动了！

original: Gallery: An undead?![p/][s/] Created [i]within[/i] the Imperial Academy?!
translation: Gallery: 僵尸？！[p/][s/]还是在帝国学院[i]里[/i]创造出来的？！

original: Gallery: How reprehensible!
translation: Gallery: 多么不道德！

original: TYRION: That’s ridiculous![p/][s/] She had a hole in her stomach when the twins found her!
translation: TYRION: 太荒谬了！[p/][s/]她被双胞胎发现的时候腹部可是有个洞！

original: TYRION: Jan Hughes would have noticed that!
translation: TYRION: 简·休斯肯定会注意到这一点！

original: ARIA: [b]Animate Corpse[/b] stops the flow of blood.[p/] So she wouldn’t have tracked blood anywhere.
translation: ARIA: [b]活化死尸[/b]可以停止血液流动。[p/]所以她不会在其他任何地方留下血迹。

original: ARIA: The defendant is also proficient with [b]illusion[/b] magic.
translation: ARIA: 被告也熟练掌握[b]幻觉[/b]系法术。

original: ARIA: He could have easily used an [b]illusion[/b] spell to hide the undead Bellwether’s wounds.
translation: ARIA: 对他来说使用一个[b]幻觉[/b]魔法隐藏僵尸化贝尔维瑟的伤口也很简单。

original: TYRION: But another party could have easily used [b]illusion[/b] magic to disguise themselves as the victim.
translation: TYRION: 但其他人也可以轻易地使用[b]幻觉[/b]魔法把自己装扮成被害人。

original: ARIA: If that were true,[p/] how did they move the body to the classroom?
translation: ARIA: 如果是那样的话，[p/]他们又怎么能把尸体移动到教室里？

original: TYRION: …
translation: TYRION: ……

original: JUDGE: Hm…
translation: JUDGE: 嗯……

original: JUDGE: Ms. Steelwind.[p/] If your theory is true,[p/] it would mean that the murder occurred elsewhere.
translation: JUDGE: 斯蒂尔文德女士。[p/]如果你的主张是真实情况，[p/]那就意味着谋杀发生在其他的地方。

original: JUDGE: Would the Inquisition happen to know where?
translation: JUDGE: 裁判所知道是哪里吗？

original: ARIA: ...Regrettably,[p/] we do not.
translation: ARIA: ……很遗憾，[p/]我们不知道。

original: Tyrion: Then the prosecution's case against my client is still faulty!
translation: Tyrion: 那么检察官对我的当事人的指控仍然是错误的！

original: Tyrion: You can't convict my client without more evidence!
translation: Tyrion: 在没有其他证据的情况下，你不能判我的委托人有罪！

original: JUDGE: I agree with Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: JUDGE: 本庭同意卡斯伯特先生。

original: JUDGE: With these new developments,[p/] the court sees it fit to suspend the trial for the time being.
translation: JUDGE: 依据新发现的事实，[p/]本次庭审应当暂时中断。

original: JUDGE: We will give law enforcement time to investigate these unknowns.
translation: JUDGE: 我们将给执法部门时间来调查未知的情况。

original: JUDGE: Court proceedings for this case will resume tomorrow morning.
translation: JUDGE: 此案的庭审程序将在明天一早继续进行。

original: JUDGE: Court is adjourned.
translation: JUDGE: 休庭。

original: CELESTE: Hey…[p/] Are you feeling okay?
translation: CELESTE: 嘿……[p/]你感觉还好吗？

original: A body is seen moving around an hour after death…
translation: 被害者死后一个小时尸体被目击四处移动……

original: It clearly wasn't Bellwether...[p/] Or at the very least,[p/] she wasn't alive when this happened.
translation: 那肯定不是贝尔维瑟本人……[p/]或者至少可以认为，[p/]那个时候她已经死了。

original: So, what was it?
translation: 所以到底发生了什么事情？

original: CELESTE: Tyrion…?
translation: CELESTE: 提利昂……？

original: There’s [b]illusion[/b] magic involved…[p/] There has to be.
translation: 还有人使用了[b]幻觉[/b]魔法……[p/]也确实应该是这样。

original: But which spell was it?
translation: 但具体使用了那种法术？

original: Could it have been [b]Illusory Disguise[/b]?
translation: 有可能是[b]幻象伪装[/b]吗？

original: CELESTE: Tyrion!
translation: CELESTE: 提利昂！

original: TYRION: Ah…![p/] What...?
translation: TYRION: 啊……！[p/]怎么了……？

original: CELESTE: You’ve been quiet since the trial ended.
translation: CELESTE: 庭审结束后你都不说话。

original: Celeste: You were making me worried...
translation: Celeste: 搞得我好担心……

original: Tyrion: S-[p/]Sorry…[p/] I was just thinking about what Steelwind said.
translation: Tyrion: 抱、[p/]抱歉……[p/]我只是在推敲斯蒂尔文德那几句话。

original: CELESTE: You mean about her theory?
translation: CELESTE: 你是说她的主张？

original: CELESTE: It’s a little creepy when you think about it…
translation: CELESTE: 仔细想想，这还有点令人毛骨悚然……

original: CELESTE: Do you really think someone turned the professor into an undead?
translation: CELESTE: 你真的觉得有人把教授变成了僵尸吗？

original: TYRION: I don’t think so.[p/] The prosecution’s case is hinged on one clear fact:
translation: TYRION: 我觉得不是。[p/]检方的立证建立在一个明确的事实之上：

original: TYRION: …That Wallace was the only high-level necromancer nearby.
translation: TYRION: 华莱士是当时附近唯一一个高阶死灵法师。

original: TYRION: We have to assume that he’s the only person capable of using that type of magic.
translation: TYRION: 我们只能认为他是唯一一个能使用那一类魔法的人。

original: CELESTE: But then how was she walking around…?
translation: CELESTE: 那她又怎么四处走动的……？

original: TYRION: I don’t know…[p/] It doesn’t make any sense.
translation: TYRION: 我不知道……[p/]根本就说不通。

original: TYRION: It’s a given that Wallace didn’t touch the body.[p/] So we can discount the use of high-level [b]necromancy[/b]…
translation: TYRION: 很显然华莱士没有触碰过尸体。[p/]所以我们不用考虑高阶[b]死灵术[/b]有被使用的情形……

original: CELESTE: No matter what,[p/] someone used an [b]illusion[/b].
translation: CELESTE: 不论怎么说，[p/]有人使用了[b]幻觉[/b]魔法。

original: CELESTE: But aren’t there spells that can create freestanding illusions? Not just disguises?
translation: CELESTE: 可是难道没有法术能创造一个自主活动的幻象，而不仅仅是一个伪装吗?

original: TYRION: Hm…[p/] I honestly don’t know…
translation: TYRION: 嗯……[p/]这我确实不清楚……

original: TYRION: We’d need to talk to someone who knows about that type of magic.
translation: TYRION: 我们得找个知道这类魔法的人谈一谈。

original: TYRION: …
translation: TYRION: ……

original: TYRION: Wait…[p/] Didn’t Eris say that she was studying [b]illusion[/b] magic?
translation: TYRION: 等下……[p/]厄莉斯不是说过她一直在研习[b]幻觉[/b]魔法吗？

original: TYRION: She might be able to tell us if something like that is possible.
translation: TYRION: 如果那种事情办得到的话，她可能会告诉我们怎么实现。

original: CELESTE: …Is that really a good idea?
translation: CELESTE: ……这个主意真的好吗？

original: TYRION: What do you mean?
translation: TYRION: 什么意思？

original: CELESTE: What if...[p/][s/] [i]she’s[/i] the one who created the illusion?!
translation: CELESTE: 如果……[p/][s/][i]她就是[/i]制造那那个幻象的人呢？

original: TYRION: What…?
translation: TYRION: 啊……？

original: You’re detecting fear from her again.
translation: 你有一次从她身上探测到恐惧的反应。

original: TYRION: Celeste are you...[p/] scared of Eris?
translation: TYRION: 塞莱斯特，你是不是……[p/]有点怕厄莉斯啊？

original: CELESTE: W-[p/][s/]What?![p/][s/] N-[p/][s/]No…!
translation: CELESTE: 什、[p/][s/]什么呀？！[p/][s/]我、[p/][s/]我才没有……！

original: TYRION: I saw it this morning too.
translation: TYRION: 我早上也发现了。

original: TYRION: You always get really scared when she’s around.
translation: TYRION: 她在附近的时候你总是很害怕。

original: CELESTE: O-[p/][s/]Oh.[p/] I thought I was doing a better job of hiding it…
translation: CELESTE: 噢、[p/][s/]啊。我以为我隐藏得还不错呢……

original: CELESTE: …
translation: CELESTE: ……

original: CELESTE: Sorry,[p/] it’s not based on anything real,[p/] but…
translation: CELESTE: 对不起，[p/]虽然这没有什么事实依据，[p/]但是……

original: CELESTE: For years,[p/] I’ve been working as a mercenary.
translation: CELESTE: 这些年来，[p/]我一直以佣兵为生。

original: CELESTE: When you do that kind of work,[p/] you build up an…[p/] instinct to sense danger.
translation: CELESTE: 你如果从事那种职业，[p/]你就会培养出一种……[p/]感知危险的直觉。

original: CELESTE: You kind of have to if you want to stay alive.
translation: CELESTE: 你想活下来就必须要这么做。

original: TYRION: Sorry…[p/] I never knew.
translation: TYRION: 抱歉……[p/]我从没想过这一点。

original: CELESTE: Tyrion.[p/] I’ve fought literal monsters and barely escaped with my life.
translation: CELESTE: 提利昂。[p/]我与字面意义上的那些怪物战斗过，好不容易才捡回一条命。

original: CELESTE: But when I’m near Eris,[p/] none of those creatures come even close.
translation: CELESTE: 但我靠近厄莉斯的时候，[p/]我觉得那些怪物与她相比甚至不值一提。

original: CELESTE: I get this…[p/] feeling.[p/] It's like I’m in front of a predator that I couldn’t ever hope to beat.
translation: CELESTE: 我就是有这种……[p/]感觉。[p/]就好像我站在一个根本没希望打败的捕食者面前。

original: CELESTE: Every instinct I have tells me to run whenever she’s close by.
translation: CELESTE: 不论什么时候，只要她一接近，我的每一个直觉都在告诉我快跑。

original: TYRION: Really…?[p/] But she doesn’t seem that dangerous.
translation: TYRION: 真的吗……？[p/]但她看上去也没那么危险吧。

original: CELESTE: I-[p/]I know…[p/] I think maybe I’m just anxious or something.
translation: CELESTE: 我、[p/]我知道……[p/]我想也可能只是我最近很焦虑或怎么样。

original: CELESTE: [i]I[/i] should know better than anyone not to judge people by their appearance.
translation: CELESTE: 但[i]我[/i]比谁都清楚不要以貌取人。

original: CELESTE: …
translation: CELESTE: ……

original: CELESTE: S-[p/]Sorry,[p/] forget I said anything.
translation: CELESTE: 对、[p/]对不起。[p/]忘掉我刚刚说的东西吧。

original: CELESTE: If you think we should talk to her,[p/] then we should do that.
translation: CELESTE: 如果你觉得我们应该和她对话，[p/]那我们就应该去做。

original: You’re not one to discount Celeste’s instincts.
translation: 你不会低估塞莱斯特的直觉。

original: She's always been reliable.[p/] And if Eris is making [i]her[/i] scared,[p/] that must mean something.
translation: 她总是很可靠。[p/]而且如果厄莉斯能让[i]她[/i]感到恐惧，[p/]那一定意味着什么。

original: But if Eris really [i]is[/i] that dangerous,[p/] then that’s all the more reason to talk to her.
translation: 但如果厄莉斯真的[i]有[/i]那么危险，[p/]那就更有理由和她谈谈了。

original: TYRION: But aside from that,[p/] there was also something else that the prosecutor said.
translation: TYRION: 但除开这个理由，[p/]还因为那个检察官说过这么几句话。

original: ARIA: Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] There was a witness who saw the victim before the body was found:[p/] Jan Hughes.
translation: ARIA: 卡斯伯特先生。[p/]其实有一位在被害人尸体被发现前见到过她本人的目击者：简·休斯。

original: ARIA: He,[p/] along with another witness,[p/] spotted Bellwether walking in the hallways before the body was found.
translation: ARIA: 他，[p/]与另一位证人一起，[p/]在贝尔维瑟的尸体被发现看到过她在走廊路过。

original: TYRION: She said,[p/] “along with another witness”.
translation: TYRION: 她这么说的，[p/]“与另一位证人一起”。

original: TYRION: That means that there was another witness that saw Bellwether walking around.
translation: TYRION: 也就是说当时还有另一个目击者看到贝尔维瑟正在走动。

original: CELESTE: Right…[p/] Jan probably isn’t the most reliable witness.
translation: CELESTE: 你说得对……[p/]而且简应该不是那个最靠谱的目击者。

original: CELESTE: So, talking to that other person might help us figure out what happened.
translation: CELESTE: 所以与另一个目击者谈谈可能对搞清楚事情经过有帮助。

original: CELESTE: …But do you think Steelwind will tell us who that witness was?
translation: CELESTE: ……不过你觉得斯蒂尔文德会告诉我们谁是那个目击者吗？

original: TYRION: At this point,[p/] we won’t lose anything by trying.
translation: TYRION: 就这一点来说，[p/]我们试一下也没什么损失。

original: In any case,[p/] it looks like you have your work cut out for you.
translation: 但不管怎么说，[p/]你有很多事情要去做。

original: So, where should you start first?
translation: 那么，该从哪里开始呢？

original: JUDGE: Court is now resumed for the trial of Wallace Nightgrave.
translation: JUDGE: 现在就华莱士·奈特格雷夫一案继续审理。

original: JUDGE: Let us review the proceedings from yesterday.
translation: JUDGE: 我们先就昨日的诉讼情况进行回顾。

original: JUDGE: It was revealed that the trace of [b]necromancy[/b] may have not been left by the defendant.
translation: JUDGE: 昨日已当庭证明，[b]死灵术[/b]的魔法痕迹很可能不是由被告造成的。

original: JUDGE: It may have been left by a witness who used [b]necromancy[/b] to attempt to [i]heal[/i] the victim.
translation: JUDGE: 很有可能是一位目击证人在尝试[i]治愈[/i]被害人时使用了 [b]死灵术[/b]并留下魔法痕迹。

original: JUDGE: However,[p/] the victim was seen by witnesses well after her time of death.
translation: JUDGE: 然而，[p/]被害人曾在推定死亡时间之后被目击到有正常活动。

original: JUDGE: This could only be explained by the defendant using [b]necromancy[/b] to animate the victim’s body.
translation: JUDGE: 目前只可以解释为是被告使用了[b]死灵术[/b]驱动了被害人的尸体。

original: JUDGE: This leaves the question:[p/] [i]Where[/i] did the murder take place?
translation: JUDGE: 这产生了一个新问题：[p/]即谋杀案究竟发生在[i]什么地方[/i]？

original: JUDGE: Does the prosecution have an answer for this?
translation: JUDGE: 请问检方是否已经找到了这个问题的答案？

original: ARIA: Based on the testimonies of several witnesses,[p/] it is very likely that the murder took place in the library.
translation: ARIA: 基于几位目击者给出的证词，[p/]谋杀很可能发生在图书馆内。

original: JUDGE: Interesting…[p/] What led you to this conclusion, Ms. Steelwind?
translation: JUDGE: 这个说法令人在意……[p/]是什么让你作出结论的，斯蒂尔文德女士？

original: ARIA: First,[p/] I’d like to remind the court [i]where[/i] the victim was sighted before the body was found.
translation: ARIA: 首先，[p/]我提请法庭各位回忆一下，受害者在尸体被发现之前就曾被目击到。

original: ARIA: It began when the victim had a meeting with the headmaster near the center of the building.
translation: ARIA: 事情是从受害者与校长于大楼中心附近会面时开始的。

original: Theodore: Our meeting was scheduled for 12:00 PM.[p/] According to my schedule for that day,[p/] our meeting lasted for an hour.
translation: Theodore: 我们约好在中午12点见面。[p/]根据我当天的行程安排，[p/]这次会面持续了一个小时。

original: Aria: This brings us to the statement of the next witness:[p/] a student at the academy.
translation: Aria: 这个事实引出下一个证言：[p/]其证人是学院的一名学生。

original: Aria: This student saw the victim walking in the hallways.
translation: Aria: 而这名学生看到了被害人从走廊经过。

original: Miriam: I saw her coming out of the headmaster’s office.
translation: Miriam: 我看到她从校长室出来。

original: Miriam: She was heading towards the library.
translation: Miriam: 然后她向图书馆的方向走过去。

original: Aria: Which means that our first witness saw Bellwether leave the headmaster’s office.
translation: Aria: 这意味着第一位目击者看到了贝尔维瑟离开校长室。

original: Aria: Presumably,[p/] this would have happened [i]after[/i] her meeting there.
translation: Aria: 可以推测，[p/]这也发生在她的会面[i]之后[/i]。

original: Aria: [i]That[/i] would time this encounter at around 1:00 PM.
translation: Aria: 也即[i]这次[/i]目击是在下午1点左右发生。

original: Aria: The other event is the discovery of the body,[p/] which was when Valentina Ianus contacted security.
translation: Aria: 另一件事情是尸体被人发现，[p/]发生事件与瓦伦蒂娜·伊努斯联系安保相同。

original: Valerie: I suddenly spotted the professor lying in a pool of blood in the classroom.
translation: Valerie: 我突然发现在教室里，教授倒在一片血泊之中。

original: Valerie: Valentina used a communication device to call for help while I tried to save her.
translation: Valerie: 瓦伦蒂娜用通讯设备呼叫求助，我同时试着挽救教授。

original: Aria: As we’ve already established,[p/] this event occurred at 3:04 PM.
translation: Aria: 正如我们已经确认的，[p/]这件事发生在下午3:04。

original: Aria: But the significance of this time is in what occurred [i]before[/i] the body was discovered.
translation: Aria: 然而真正有意义的是尸体被发现[i]之前[/i]发生的事情。

original: Aria: The second witness,[p/] a member of the cleaning staff,[p/] spotted the victim in the west-wing hallway.
translation: Aria: 第二位目击证人，[p/]一位清洁工，[p/]在西翼走廊里见到了被害人。

original: Jan: Bellwether knocked over a vase…[p/] And there were shards and dirt everywhere.
translation: Jan: 贝尔维瑟撞到了一个花瓶……[p/]搞得满地都是碎片和泥土。

original: Jan: It was probably 20-30 minutes before the twins found the body.
translation: Jan: 那大概是那对双胞胎发现尸体前20到30分钟时发生的。

original: Aria: This means that this encounter must have happened no later than 2:30 PM.
translation: Aria: 这意味着那一次目击必然发生在下午2:30之后。

original: Aria: And [i]this[/i] implies that the victim was near the library between 1:00 PM and 2:30 PM.
translation: Aria: 而[i]这[/i]也表示，被害人于下午1:00到2:30之间的位置在图书馆附近。

original: Aria: According to the defendant’s statements,[p/] he was in the Library during this time period.
translation: Aria: 根据被告人的说法，[p/]这个时段他在图书馆里。

original: Aria: Furthermore,[p/] the time of death was at 2:07 PM.
translation: Aria: 此外，[p/]死亡时间是下午2:07.

original: Aria: This means that Mr. Hughes saw the victim’s animated body.
translation: Aria: 也就意味着休斯先生看到的是被害人的尸体。

original: JUDGE: I see.[p/] Your deduction certainly tracks, Ms. Steelwind.
translation: JUDGE: 本庭明白了。[p/]你的推论非常充分，斯蒂尔文德女士。

original: JUDGE: What do you have to say in your defense, Mr. Cuthbert?
translation: JUDGE: 你作为辩方有什么意见，卡斯伯特先生？

original: TYRION: The prosecution’s argument is definitely well thought-out, Your Honor.
translation: TYRION: 法官阁下，检方的推论的确经过深思熟虑。

original: TYRION: …However,[p/] it is entirely predicated on the testimonies of all the witnesses involved.
translation: TYRION: ……然而，[p/]这完全基于全体相关证人的证词。

original: ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: ……

original: Steelwind’s deduction has to have a hole somewhere…
translation: 斯蒂尔文德的推论一定在某处有个漏洞……

original: And since your conversation yesterday,[p/] you’ve had a feeling that Miriam is hiding something…
translation: 而且回想你昨天的对话内容，[p/]你感觉米莉亚姆还在隐藏什么东西……

original: If you want to get to the truth,[p/] you’ll need to drag that out of her through a cross-examination.
translation: 如果你想要找到真相，[p/]你需要把她拖上证人席并进行交叉讯问。

original: TYRION: Your Honor.[p/] To test the validity of these claims,[p/] the defense would like both of these witnesses to testify.
translation: TYRION: 法官阁下，[p/]为了检验这些说法是否正确，[p/]辩方希望两个目击者都能当庭作证。

original: Tyrion: The defense calls Miriam Frega to the stand.
translation: Tyrion: 辩方要求传唤米莉亚姆·弗雷加出庭。

original: JUDGE: F-[p/][s/]Frega?!
translation: JUDGE: 弗、[p/][s/]弗雷加？！

original: At the mention of her name,[p/] the judge’s face turns a bit pale.
translation: 提到她的姓氏，[p/]法官的脸色都有点变白了。

original: ARIA: …I had a feeling it would come to this.
translation: ARIA: ……我就感觉会变成这个样子。

original: JUDGE: D-[p/][s/]Do you have any objections, Ms. Steelwind…?
translation: JUDGE: 你、[p/][s/]你有异议吗，斯蒂尔文德女士……？

original: Aria: I do not, Your Honor.
translation: Aria: 本人没有意见，法官阁下。

original: Judge: …V-[p/]Very well.
translation: Judge: ……那、[p/]那好吧。

original: Judge: Bailiff.[p/] Please escort…[p/] [i]Lady[/i] Frega to the stand.
translation: Judge: 法警。[p/]请护送……[p/]弗雷加[i]小姐[/i]到证人席。

original: ARIA: Witness,[p/] please state your name and occupation for the-
translation: ARIA: 证人，[p/]请陈述你的姓名与职业——

original: MIRIAM: You little snakes!
translation: MIRIAM: 你这个小骗子！

original: MIRIAM: How [i]dare[/i] you deceive me!
translation: MIRIAM: 你怎么[i]敢[/i]欺骗本小姐！

original: CELESTE: O-[p/]Oh…[p/] It looks like she found out.
translation: CELESTE: 哎、[p/]哎呀……[p/]看起来她已经发现了。

original: ARIA: I had the opportunity to debrief the witness beforehand.
translation: ARIA: 我正好有机会事先询问证人情况。

original: ARIA: …Ms. McCoy,[p/] for the record,[p/] I told you to “exercise discretion”.
translation: ARIA: ……麦考伊小姐，[p/]再一次郑重声明，[p/]我是告诉你要“谨慎应变”。

original: ARIA: I did not mean that you should impersonate a member of my family.
translation: ARIA: 我的意思可不是让你冒称我的家族成员。

original: CELESTE: Y-[p/]Yeah…[p/] Sorry about that.
translation: CELESTE: 你、[p/]你说得对……[p/]这件事我道歉。

original: MIRIAM: I gave you [i]all[/i] of the tea that I imported from the Eastern Kingdoms!
translation: MIRIAM: 我还吧从东方古国进口的茶叶[i]都[/i]送给你了！

original: MIRIAM: I demand that you return it to me!
translation: MIRIAM: 我要求你还给我！

original: CELESTE: No![p/][s/] You gave them to me![p/][s/] They’re [i]legally[/i] mine now!
translation: CELESTE: 不行！[p/][s/]你自己赠送给我的！[p/][s/]从[i]法律上[/i]来讲现在就是我的了！

original: JUDGE: A-[p/][s/]Ahem…
translation: JUDGE: 咳、[p/][s/]咳……

original: JUDGE: I’m not sure what your business with the witness is, Ms. McCoy.
translation: JUDGE: 本庭不太确定你和证人在会见有什么嫌隙，麦考伊女士。

original: JUDGE: But I’d ask that you please handle your personal disputes [i]outside[/i] of the courtroom.
translation: JUDGE: 但是本庭要求，请你在[i]法庭之外[/i]解决你的个人纠纷。

original: ARIA: …Anyways, Miriam,[p/] could you please testify to the court about your encounter with the victim?
translation: ARIA: ……总之，米莉亚姆，[p/]你能就与证人的相遇向法庭作证吗？

original: MIRIAM: …Very well.
translation: MIRIAM: ……好吧。

original: Miriam: I was working on a research project in my dorm room when I decided to take a break.
translation: Miriam: 我当时正在自己宿舍里进行一个研究项目，然后想休息一下。

original: Miriam: I left my room and went on a walk.[p/] That’s when I saw Professor Bellwether exiting the Headmaster’s Office.
translation: Miriam: 我离开房间然后散了下步。[p/]那时我正好看到贝尔维瑟教授正从校长室出来。

original: Miriam: She was walking in my direction.[p/] So I greeted her and she responded in kind.
translation: Miriam: 她正好向我这边走过来，[p/]所以我向她问好，她也和蔼地回应了我。

original: Miriam: After that,[p/] she headed towards the library.
translation: Miriam: 在那之后，[p/]她直接向图书馆走了过去。

original: Miriam: A short time after that,[p/] I went back to my room and continued my work.
translation: Miriam: 又过了一小会儿，[p/]我回到宿舍继续做研究。

original: JUDGE: I see…[p/] So it was only a brief encounter.
translation: JUDGE: 明白了……[p/]也就是说那次只是打了个照面。

original: ARIA: However brief it was,[p/] the witness’s testimony verifies two things.
translation: ARIA: 不论这次会话多简单，[p/]证人的证词确认了两件事。

original: ARIA: One is that Ms. Frega saw the professor exiting the Headmaster’s Office.
translation: ARIA: 其一，弗雷加女士看到了教授正从校长室走出来。

original: ARIA: The other is that she witnessed the victim head toward the library.
translation: ARIA: 其二，她看到被害人走向图书馆。

original: ARIA: This gives us a rough timeline of where the victim was before her death.
translation: ARIA: 这就让我们能得出被害人死前大致的行动时间线。

original: JUDGE: Hm…[p/] That [i]does[/i] seem consistent.
translation: JUDGE: 嗯……[p/]这看起来[i]是[/i]一致的。

original: Did Bellwether really enter the library that day?
translation: 贝尔维瑟那天真的进入了图书馆吗？

original: You feel like you would have seen her there if she did.
translation: 如果她真的进来了，你感觉你应该会看到她。

original: Judge: Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] You may begin your cross-examination.
translation: Judge: 卡斯伯特先生，[p/]你可以开始交叉讯问了。

original: Miriam: I was working on a research project in my dorm room when I decided to take a break.
translation: Miriam: 我当时正在自己宿舍里进行一个研究项目，然后想休息一下。

original: TYRION: Was this research project a part of your schoolwork?
translation: TYRION: 这个研究项目是你的学校作业吗？

original: MIRIAM: It was an independent study to develop a new [b]conjuration[/b] spell formula.
translation: MIRIAM: 这是一个关于创造新的[b]召唤[/b]法术范式的独立研究。

original: MIRIAM: The project is being sponsored by the Crown Prince, himself.
translation: MIRIAM: 该项目由王储殿下本人直接赞助。

original: ARIA: …
translation: ARIA: ……

original: ARIA: I...[p/] wasn’t aware that he was involved in such a study.
translation: ARIA: 我……[p/]还真不知道他参与了这样的学术活动。

original: MIRIAM: Of course, you wouldn't.[p/] Did you expect to know every aspect of his life, dear Aria?
translation: MIRIAM: 你当然不知道。[p/]亲爱的阿莉亚，你期望了解他生活的方方面面吗？

original: …You sense a [i]bit[/i] of aggression.
translation: ……你感觉这话有[i]一点[/i]挑衅意味。

original: MIRIAM: If you don’t keep an eye on him,[p/] House Frega might just steal him back from you.
translation: MIRIAM: 如果你不把他盯紧了，弗雷加一族可能把她从你手上偷回来哦。
